Question_Title: Subsequent to a oil spill in Engine Room and ingress of oil in the bilge wells ,the best course of action is to _______________________________
Answer_1: Use oil spill dispersant chemical in the bilge wells
Answer_2: Transfer the oily mixture and let it settle in the bilge holding tank/bilge separator tank
Answer_3: Transfer the oily mixture using a portable pneumatic pump to a waste oil tank and then physically demark and clean the bilge wells using environment friendly cleaner
Answer_4: Dilute the bilge wells by flooding with water and then use the general service pump to pump out the bilges

Question_Title: In case of an exhaust gas boiler fire ,which of the following is a suitable control measure?
Answer_2: Increase main engine speed to blow away the soot particles on fire
Answer_3: Stop cooling water circulation to avoid leakage

Question_Title: What type of tubes used in Air comp cooler?
The water from discharge side of the centrifugal pump is supplied as sealing water to the stuffing box for the pump shaft at:
Which of the following would be the correct way(s) of using a torque wrench?
Answer_1: Application of jerk pulls while tightening
Answer_3: Tightening beyond the characteristic clicking sound

Question_Title: Chromium is a nobler metal when compared to that of steel. In some marine applications Chromium is electroplated to the steel surfaces. Why?
Answer_1: Chromium is a more noble metal so it will not get corroded and thus steel surfaces will remain protected
Answer_2: Chromium plating provides corrosion protection as well as high glossiness and high hardness for better wear resistance and reduced friction to the steel surfaces
Answer_3: Chromium plating is required for providing high glossiness and high hardness for better wear resistance and reduced friction to the steel surfaces and not for corrosion protection
Answer_4: Chromium reacts with steel to form an alloy during electroplating which is corrosion resistant

Question_Title: Centrifugal pumps cannot handle air and require priming. But you are aware that centrifugal which on the same principal can handle air very well. Which two properties of air are responsible because of which the centrifugal pumps cannot handle air:-

Pump driven clutch type attached vacuum pumps are commonly used for priming ballast pumps and emergency fire pumps. What is the factor which clutches the vacuum pump clutch to the pump clutch during start of the pump?
Answer_1: Low suction pressure acting against the spring loaded clutching piston
Answer_2: High suction pressure acting against the spring loaded clutching piston
Answer_3: Low discharge pressure acting against the spring loaded clutching piston
Answer_4: High discharge pressure acting against the spring loaded clutching piston

Question_Title: It is given that engine room bilge pump has suction manifold on which 3 valves are located. One valve for the 3 engine room bilge wells suction, another one for Bilge tank suction and the third one is for sea water suction. It is found that the Bilge pump is unable to take suction from any of the bilge wells, but is able to take suction efficiently from Bilge tank. What is the most probable cause?
Answer_1: Pump suction filter cover gasket leaking
Answer_2: Suction filter cover gasket of one of the Bilge wells is leaking
Answer_3: Bilge well suction pipeline leaking between individual bilge well valves and suction manifold valve
Answer_4: Bilge pump suction pipeline leaking between the manifold and the pump

Question_Title: It has been reported that Engine room bilge pump was unable to take suction from Fwd. (P) bilge well while it taking suction efficiently from Fwd.(S) & aft bilge wells. What could be the most probable cause?
Answer_1: There is leakage in the bilge suction pipeline somewhere between the bilge wells and bilge pump
Answer_2: The Fwd. (P) bilge well suction valve might be leaking
Answer_3: The Fwd. (P) bilge well suction filter cover gasket might be leaking
Answer_4: The pump needs to be overhauled

Question_Title: Which of the following is a correct point for sampling of system lube oil for on board or shore analysis?
Answer_3: Inlet or outlet of L. O. coolers

Question_Title: Which type of valve is not rotating type....
Emergency steering testing
Which of the following valves cannot prevent backflow of liquid in a pipeline?
Pump driven clutch type attached vacuum pumps are commonly used for priming ballast pumps and emergency fire pump. What is the factor which de-clutches the vacuum pump from the pump clutch?
Answer_1: Low suction pressure acting against the spring loaded declutching piston
Answer_2: High suction pressure acting against the spring loaded declutching piston
Answer_3: Low discharge pressure acting against the spring loaded declutching piston
Answer_4: High discharge pressure acting against the spring loaded declutching piston

Question_Title: The main disadvantages of a reciprocating pump over a Gear pump is that:
Answer_1: A gear pump is self priming while a reciprocating pump is not
Answer_2: Discharge of a gear pump is not affected by the direction of rotation while that of reciprocating pump is reversed
Answer_3: The discharge of reciprocating pump is pulsating and discharge rate is lesser
Answer_4: Reciprocating pumps are only available in high capacities and for smaller capacities only gear pumps can be used

Question_Title: After cleaning the sea chest filter you have placed the filter in the body and tightened the cover. Which one of the following is the best alternative?
Answer_1: You can open the filter inlet and outlet valves & directly start using the filter
Answer_2: If you do not want to use the sea chest in question, you need not worry and you can open the valves when required
Answer_3: Sea Water inlet valve should be crack opened, the filter body should be purged, any leakages and thereafter filter can be kept isolated or used as required
Answer_4: You will close the other side sea chest valves first and then open this side sea chest filter inlet and outlet valves

Question_Title: In which of the following types of refractory failure, softening of the refractory bricks takes place due to presence of sodium/vanadium in fuel?
centrifugal pump will typically give you a low flow rate at a lower pressure, where a piston pump will give you more pressure and higher flow rate. Is the statement correct?
Answer_3: First Sentence is right. Second one is wrong

Question_Title: You are pumping out sludge to a shore facility using your sludge pump. You find that the discharge rate of pump is very slow and suction filter is getting clogged frequently. What is the best alternative to counteract the problem?
Answer_1: Remove the pump suction filter and pump out the tank
Answer_2: Increase the tank temperature, keep an eye on the pump suction pressure and clean the filter as soon as it drops
Answer_3: As soon as the as the shore facility tells you that they are not receiving any sludge, you stop the pump and clean the filter
Answer_4: Fabricate a bigger mesh size suction filter and use in place of normal filter so that frequency of filter blockage is reduced and you can get a better discharge rate

Question_Title: A ball valve is found leaking in service and needs to be overhauled. What type of repairs can be carried out?
Answer_1: The ball and seat can be lapped together
Answer_2: The ball can be machined while the seat can be replaced
Answer_3: Normally both the non-metallic seats get worn out and have to be replaced
Answer_4: Normally ball gets damaged and has to be replaced

Purifier is not rotating with desired rpm, reason?
The function of an accumulator on the discharge side of a reciprocating bilge pump is to:
Answer_1: Supply liquid even when the pump is not running
Answer_2: Dampen out the pressure pulses and smoothen the flow
Answer_3: Increase the discharge pressure by storing liquid under pressure
Answer_4: No such device is required to be fitted to modern bilge pumps

Question_Title: The most important control measure to prevent boiler tube failure is:
Answer_2: Proper maintenance of fuel burning equipment
Answer_3: Proper maintenance of boiler water condition

Question_Title: F.O. transfer pump was working efficiently, but it stopped taking suction suddenly. There is a sounding of 6.0 m in the F.O. deep tank. The suction pressure gauge was renewed recently and is showing a positive pressure when pump is running, but Pump is not transferring any F.O. What is the most probable cause?
Answer_1: Pump is damaged and needs overhaul
Answer_2: Suction filter cover gasket might leaking
Answer_3: Pump relief valve might be leaking
Answer_4: The pump suction pipeline is blocked

Question_Title: A ball valve was found leaking in service. Upon inspection it was found that the PTFE seat had worn out and was renewed. The valve stopped leaking in closed condition. How do think a ball valve provides perfect sealing?
Answer_1: The seat fitted is slightly smaller than the outer dimensions of the ball, thus providing interference fit when closed
Answer_2: Either a floating seat is pressed onto trunnion supported ball by liquid pressure or floating ball is pressed onto the seat
Answer_3: Ball is not exactly spherical and is shaped such that during closure the surface coming into contact with seat is of slightly bigger diameter providing sealing
Answer_4: Seat is not exactly spherical, but slightly tapered so that during closure the ball sits tightly on the seat

Question_Title: Copper tubing is used in refrigerant system because
Answer_2: It is cheaper compared to other materials.
Answer_3: It is easier to check leaks in copper based system

Question_Title: U R responsible for daily transfers of engine room bilges. U follow the sequences aft –fwd (P)-fwd(s) bilge well n u have never experienced a problem but 5/E started the transfer n first transferred forward (s) bilge well n without any problem n u join him later u find that bilge pump is not taking suction fr f(p) n aft bilge well n then u have checked everything is normal. What is the cause?
Answer_1: 5th engineer made a mistake by 1st transferring the fwd (s) bilge well, normal sequence of operation for engine room machineries should not b disturbed.
Answer_2: Fwd (s) Bilge well suction valve is leaking
Answer_3: Bilge pump suction filter cover gasket is leaking.
Answer_4: Fwd (s) Bilge well suction filter cover gasket is leaking.

Question_Title: Function of a de-superheater is to.
Answer_3: Increase the efficiency of the boiler
Answer_4: Reduce steam temperature for auxiliary uses after steam superheater

Question_Title: A good quality oil used in main propulsion engine lubrication systems should be __________.

Question_Title: The vessel's steering gear is a classic example of a positioner type automation system.  The variable input is provided through the steering wheel, and the rudder position is fed back to the operating mechanism.  The difference between the input signal and the follow-up signal, until matched and cancelled, is the __________.
Erosive tube failure in a heat exchanger can result from __________.
The torque rating of a fluid power motor is expressed in __________.
Answer_1: RPMs under a given load condition
Answer_4: foot-pounds per rate of input flow

Question_Title: In addition to a pressure gage and a relief valve, an air receiver should be fitted with a __________.
In the presence of an open flame or hot surfaces, chlorinated flourocarbon refrigerants decomposes and form __________.
To obtain maximum efficiency, two stage air compressors are usually __________.
Answer_4: operated in an unloaded condition at all times

Question_Title: In a pneumatic automation system, a unit producing a signal to govern the position of the controller of the measured variable, relative to the value of the measured variable, is said to have __________.
The function of the hydraulic telemotor transmitter used in an electro-hydraulic steering gear system is to __________.
Answer_1: transmit the rudder angle to the bridge indicator
Answer_2: prevent the control linkage from striking the stops when hard over
Answer_3: automatically purge all entrained air from the system
Answer_4: send hydraulic signals to the receiving unit

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is/are true regarding hydraulic pumps in general?
Answer_1: Variable volumes can be obtained with gear pumps only by variation of the pump drive speed.
Answer_2: A radial piston pump houses sliding pistons in a stationary cylinder block through which passes a rotating pintle or ported shaft.
Answer_3: The amount of fluid displaced per revolution of an axial piston rotary pump is maximum when the angle of the tilting box is at right angles to the shaft.

Question_Title: R-12 is generally considered to be a safe, nontoxic, nonflammable, and nonexplosive refrigerant.  It can, however, become highly toxic when __________.
Answer_2: in contact with an open flame

Question_Title: The difference between the pressure at a point being measured and that of a perfect vacuum is known as __________.
The diameter of a hole drilled for tapping threads into a piece of stock should be __________.
Answer_3: the same size as the tap diameter
Answer_4: the same size as the bolt diameter

Question_Title: In a low pressure air compressor, the loss of volumetric efficiency normally results from __________.
Answer_2: heating of the air leaving the cylinders
Answer_4: constant enlargement of the clearance expansion volume

Question_Title: The seal piping obtains liquid from the discharge side of the pump and directs the liquid to the __________.
While attempting to read a tank level indicator, the mercury column drops rapidly.  This may indicate __________.
Answer_1: a leak in the gage line
Answer_2: free surface effect in the tank
Answer_4: excess air in the balance chamber

Question_Title: Lint from cleaning rags can be harmful to hydraulic systems because the lint __________.
Answer_1: can cause rusting of internal parts
Answer_3: can clog filters and promote component leakage

Question_Title: An important point of consideration when replacing a dry type intake filter on an air compressor is to __________.
Answer_1: use the same wetting oil on the element as is used in the compressor lubrication system
Answer_2: install a smaller size filter to allow for expansion of the element
Answer_3: install only a filter consisting of a treated paper element
Answer_4: select the proper size filter so that air flow is not restricted

Question_Title: A refrigeration system contaminated with moisture can be affected by __________.
Some chloronated flourocarbon refrigerants may decompose into a toxic irritating gas if it is __________.
Answer_1: stored at temperatures below 60 degrees Fahrenheit
Answer_2: charged into a system having copper fittings
Answer_3: allowed to mix with compressor oil
Answer_4: exposed to an open flame or hot surface

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the relationship between viscosity and specific gravity?
Answer_1: Liquids with different viscosities will always have the same specific gravity.
Answer_2: Liquids with different viscosities will never have the same specific gravity.
Answer_3: Viscosity and specific gravity are directly proportional.
Answer_4: Viscosity and specific gravity are not related in that one  does not define or limit the other.

Question_Title: The delivery rate of a variable stroke axial piston hydraulic pump is controlled by varying the position of the __________.
Biasing, in a pneumatic automated combustion control system, refers to a set amount of increase or decrease in the __________.
If you suspect that a gage is sticking and giving an inaccurate reading, you should __________.
Answer_1: blow out the gage line with compressed air
Answer_2: tap the gage body with a wrench
Answer_3: remove the gage bezel and slightly move the needle
Answer_4: replace the gage or have it calibrated

Question_Title: One advantage of a triple-effect low pressure submerged tube distilling plant over a double-effect unit is __________.
Which of the following descriptions could be applied to short lengths of pipe called nipples?
Answer_1: Fully threaded, half threaded, long, and short
Answer_3: Standard, extra-strong, double extra-strong, and schedule 80

Question_Title: To drill a hole in round stock, perpendicular to the axis of the piece, the stock should be mounted in a __________.
For the proper control of the air temperature in an air conditioning system using chilled water circulation, which  of the listed conditions should remain constant regardless  of load changes?
Which of the following is NOT an identifiable characteristic of a steam reciprocating pump?
The pressure of a liquid leaving the pump can be referred to as the __________.
Obstructed suction passages in the casing or pintle of a radial piston hydraulic pump will cause the __________.
Answer_2: pump return and discharge pressures to equalize
Answer_4: pump discharge flow to drop to zero

Question_Title: Potable water piping systems installed aboard ships must be __________.
Answer_1: disinfected monthly with a chlorine compound
Answer_2: independent of all other piping systems
Answer_3: cadmium lined to prevent internal corrosion
Answer_4: flushed each time potable water is taken onboard

Question_Title: A pressure gage pointer responding sluggishly to changes in pressure, should be repaired by __________.
Answer_2: bending the needle to free the linkage
Answer_3: cleaning the residue from gear teeth

Question_Title: Tube leaks in the distillate cooler of a two stage flash evaporator will result in __________.
Answer_4: contamination of the second stage condenser

Question_Title: The threaded pipe fitting called 'street elbows' have __________.
Increasing the feed pressure on a drill as its point begins to break through the bottom of the workpiece will cause the drill to __________.
Answer_1: break cleanly through the bottom of the workpiece
Answer_2: cut an elongated hole in the bottom of the workpiece
Answer_3: form a tapered hole in the bottom of the workpiece
Answer_4: dig into the workpiece and tend to whirl it around

Question_Title: Air leakage between the shaft and stuffing box packing in a centrifugal pump is prevented by __________.
Answer_2: lantern rings between the packing rings

Question_Title: The suction-force principle of operation is a typical characteristic of __________.
In an automation system, increasing or decreasing the loading pressure by a set amount is known as __________.
A fuel oil tank pneumercator will give an inaccurate reading if the __________.
Answer_1: pneumercator is recharged with the air supply open
Answer_2: pneumercator balance chamber bleed orifice is blocked by the oil being measured
Answer_3: pressure in the system is allowed to equalize
Answer_4: operating cock is placed in the 'vent' position when the system is not in use

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents an advantage of a triple-effect submerged tube evaporator compared to a single-effect submerged tube evaporator?
Answer_2: Lower consumption of steam per pound of distillate produced
Answer_4: Less complex to maintain and operate

Question_Title: Hydraulic pumps most commonly used in steering systems are  of the __________.
Fittings used to close the ends of pipe are called 'pipe _____________'.
When drilling blind holes with a standard drill press, the  proper method of stopping the progress of the drill boring  through the work is by __________.
In a direct expansion type multi-box refrigeration system,  the compressor is set up to cycle on and off by the __________.
An additive used to improve the ability of a lube oil to reduce friction is known as a/an __________.
One advantage of a flash distilling plant when compared to a submerged tube distiller is __________.
Answer_1: greater distillate purity through high temperature  evaporation
Answer_2: cold shocking for scale removal is not required
Answer_3: less internal corrosion because of lower brine density
Answer_4: less feedwater is required for equal plant capacity

Question_Title: Potable and non-potable water systems aboard vessel __________.
Answer_1: may be temporarily interconnected with a removable spool
Answer_2: are permanently interconnected through a double stop valve
Answer_3: may never be interconnected by any means
Answer_4: may be connected if they are used only for wash water

Question_Title: In an electro-hydraulic steering gear system, when will the variable displacement pump be placed on stroke?
Answer_1: When the helm is at any angle other than amidships.
Answer_2: When the six-way valve is opened.
Answer_3: When the ram relief valves lift.
Answer_4: When the rudder angle is different from the position of the helm.

Question_Title: In application, which of the listed sealing devices is most similar to an O-ring?
A 'close nipple' is a piece of pipe that is __________.
Answer_3: shorter than the nipple outside diameter

Question_Title: Which of the pumping systems listed for use aboard ship will most likely use a propeller type pump?
Which of the listed operations will cause an automatically  controlled refrigeration compressor to restart?
Answer_3: An increase in the suction pressure

Question_Title: Which of the units of measurement listed below are used to  express positive and negative suction heads when calculating pump head or hydraulic horsepower?
Answer_1: Inches of mercury for positive head and feet of water for negative head
Answer_2: Feet of water for positive head and inches of mercury for negative head
Answer_3: Inches of mercury for both positive and negative heads
Answer_4: Feet of water for both positive and negative heads

Question_Title: The ability of lubricating oils to resist viscosity changes during temperature changes is indicated by the __________.
Which of the additives listed is used to reduce the foaming tendency of lube oil?
In ship construction, the shell plating is arranged in strakes and assigned letter designations.  If the strakes were lettered "A" through "K", the "K" strake will be __________.
Answer_1: at the turn of the bilge

Question_Title: To connect two lengths of pipe previously set in place, you should use a pipe __________.
One of the steps required to increase the drilling speed of a drill press is to __________.
Answer_1: move the drive belt to a smaller diameter motor pulley
Answer_2: move the drive belt to a smaller diameter spindle pulley
Answer_3: change the terminal connections of the drive motor
Answer_4: change to a larger diameter spindle

Question_Title: Saltwater is typically provided to a refrigeration system to __________.
Which of the following propeller materials will not require stress relief treatment after minor repairs, straightening  of the tips or the thinning of the blade edges?
As the designated rudder angle is being achieved, as a result of the original command input, the steering gear follow-up mechanism is __________.
Answer_1: in motion, providing a null input
Answer_2: not in motion, thus providing a null input
Answer_3: in motion, providing an input to place the main pump on maximum stroke
Answer_4: in motion, providing an input to place the main pump at null stroke

Question_Title: Which of the additives listed is used to lower the pour point of a lubricating oil?
In ship construction, the strakes are given letter  designations beginning with the letter 'A.'  The "A" strake is adjacent to the __________.
The clutch band of a constant tensioning mooring winch must be set up tight enough to drive the winch drum and should slip only when __________.
Answer_1: excessive loads are placed on the winch
Answer_2: minimum pull is being exerted by the winch
Answer_3: automatic operation of the winch is desired
Answer_4: wire is being retrieved at the maximum rate

Question_Title: Under normal operating conditions, the rudder is hydraulically locked unless __________.
Answer_1: the manual trick wheel is engaged for steering
Answer_2: the variable stroke pump is off stroke
Answer_3: a rudder order is given by the control system
Answer_4: an electric power system failure occurs at the steering gear

Question_Title: Temporary Certificates of Inspection for offshore drilling  units are effective until the __________.
Answer_2: Minerals Management Service approval is issued
Answer_4: permanent Certificate of Inspection is issued

Question_Title: A tapered shank drill is removed from the drill press spindle with a __________.
In a direct expansion type cargo refrigeration system, a box is normally changed from chill to freeze by adjusting the __________.
Lead wrapped flexible packing, rated for temperatures of up to 450°F and shaft speeds up to 1000 RPM, will not be suitable for use with __________.
Which of the following statements is correct concerning the viscosity of lubricating oil?
Answer_1: Viscosity will increase as temperature increases.
Answer_2: Viscosity is a measure of a fluid's internal resistance to  flow.
Answer_3: Viscosity will decrease as temperature decreases.
Answer_4: Viscosity is not dependent on temperature.

Question_Title: The pour point of lubricating oils is affected the most by  which of the following?
To prevent overheating and scoring of the shaft after repacking the stuffing box, which of the following  procedures should be carried out?
Answer_1: Tighten the packing in small increments while the pump is operating.
Answer_2: Lubricate the lantern ring with cylinder oil before installing new turns of packing.
Answer_3: Tightening the gland in all the way and then backing it off slightly.
Answer_4: Operating the pump slowly and applying oil freely to the shaft until the packing is properly seated.

Question_Title: When the hydraulic control lever for a deck winch is placed in the neutral or off position, the spring set brake on the fluid motor drive shaft is __________.
Answer_1: engaged by spring action and only released by hydraulic pressure
Answer_2: released by spring action and hydraulically locks the winch when the drum ceases rotating
Answer_3: engaged by spring action and is insured to be locked in place by hydraulic pressure
Answer_4: opened hydraulically and held open by spring action whenever the electrical supply is secured

Question_Title: To remove a hand held right-handed straight cut reamer after it has gone all the way through a hole, you should  __________.
Answer_1: turn the tap wrench clockwise, simultaneously raising the reamer
Answer_2: tap the reamer out with a softfaced hammer
Answer_3: turn the tap wrench counterclockwise, simultaneously raising the reamer
Answer_4: work the reamer side to side to dislodge it

Question_Title: A pressure drop in the liquid line of a refrigeration system may cause __________.
Answer_3: flash gas to form in the liquid line
Answer_4: the expansion valve to freeze open

Question_Title: Moisture and impurities can be removed from pneumatic systems by using __________.
The viscosity of an oil is a measure of its __________.
The purpose of the propeller fairwater cone is to __________.
Answer_1: lock the propeller nut in position

Question_Title: Although lube oils used in the main lubricating service systems should have a relatively high flash point to avoid  ignition, they can create smoke and fire hazards when they  __________.
Answer_2: come in contact with extremely hot surfaces
Answer_3: are reduced in temperature to just above the pour point

Question_Title: Vertical transverse structures in the double bottom are known as __________.
When the helm is turned on the navigation bridge, which of  the listed actions will be the FIRST response in the steering room on a ship equipped with an electro-hydraulic  steering gear?
Answer_1: The pumps go to full stroke.
Answer_2: The six-way valve aligns itself with the running pump.
Answer_3: Both port and starboard cables are energized.
Answer_4: The synchronous receiver turns, duplicating the helm motion.

Question_Title: If you are hand tapping holes in cast iron, you should __________.
Answer_1: tap the holes without cutting oil
Answer_2: flood the tap with mineral oil
Answer_3: chamfer the edges of the holes
Answer_4: start tapping with a plug tap

Question_Title: Certificates of Inspection for offshore drilling units are  issued for a period of __________.
Permanent centrifugal pump shaft damage due to erosion, corrosion, and wear at the stuffing box is usually prevented by __________.
On vessels using reach rods to manually control the tank valves, one turn of the handwheel on deck will produce how  many turns of the valve stem at the valve?
The flash point of most lube oils used in a main lubricating system should be approximately __________.
Hydraulic cranes must be properly warmed-up before being operated because __________.
Answer_1: warm-up allows the hydraulic system to become charged with  oil
Answer_2: warm-up allows the relief valves to be properly tested
Answer_3: hydraulic strainers operate only during the warm-up period
Answer_4: warm-up allows the hydraulic fluid to reach proper viscosity

Question_Title: In an electro-hydraulic steering gear, any change in relative position between the synchronous receiver and the  follow-up gear will result in __________.
Answer_1: the pump going to full stroke
Answer_3: driving the rams up against the stops
Answer_4: a corresponding slowing or increasing of the pumped flow rate

Question_Title: Keyless propeller hubs secured to tailshafts by 'pilgrim nuts', are removed by __________.
Which of the following statements describes the function of an air compressor intake filter?
Answer_2: Provides a positive pressure on the air inlet valves.
Answer_3: Prevents lubricating oil contamination of the compressed air supply.
Answer_4: Protects against the damaging effects of airborne solid particles.

Question_Title: Which of the listed characteristics of lube oil are the most important to the engineer from an operational standpoint?
Answer_1: Ash content, carbon residue, and gravity
Answer_3: Pour point, flash point, and precipitation number
Answer_4: Autoignition point, viscosity index, and film strength

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions will indicate a need for a finishing cut to be taken on the pump shaft?
A salinity indicating system functions on the basic principle of measuring the __________.
In ship construction, the shell plating is arranged in strakes, with four of the strakes being specifically identified by name.  The strake next to the keel is identified as the __________.
The number of screw threads per inch for a Standard National Coarse 1/2 inch bolt is __________.
After conducting a boat drill on a mobile offshore drilling unit, which of the following is the master or person in charge required to enter into the logbook?
Answer_1: The condition of the equipment used during the drill.
Answer_2: The name of the lifeboatman in charge of each lifeboat.
Answer_3: The location of the vessel at the time of the drill.
Answer_4: The time it took to lower the boat.

Question_Title: What class of bulkhead is required around the galley on a MODU?
In a flash type evaporator, all saltwater headers are vented through individual vent cocks to the __________.
An axial piston, variable stroke pump is used in a vessel's hydraulic steering gear.  Under pressure, oil continually leaks out from between the valve plate/ cylinder barrel and will __________.
Answer_1: cause loss of hydraulic oil from the system
Answer_2: result in extreme damage to the pump
Answer_3: cause damage to the pump if not continually drained from the pump casing
Answer_4: result in the system high side pressure to substantially drop off

Question_Title: The garboard strake is located __________.
Answer_3: at each side of the keel
Answer_4: at the turn of the bilge

Question_Title: A centrifugal pump vibrates excessively during operation. Upon disassembling the pump it is found that the impeller is out of balance.  Without an available spare, you should __________.
Answer_1: drill holes through the heavy side of the impeller until it balances
Answer_2: weld counterweights to the light side of the impeller
Answer_3: remove metal from the heavy side by machining in a lathe
Answer_4: acid wash and scrape the heavy side until it balances

Question_Title: Lantern rings are provided on centrifugal pumps to __________.
Answer_1: allow illuminated inspection of shaft and packing
Answer_2: provide a passage for the stuffing box sealing liquid
Answer_3: adjust leakage at the shaft gland
Answer_4: allow for distortion of the wearing rings

Question_Title: Moisture is removed from a refrigeration system by  __________.
Answer_2: opening a drain petcock on the oil separator
Answer_3: condensing the water in the heat exchanger

Question_Title: Why will a two stage flash type distilling plant tend to operate more efficiently when operating in cold seawater?
Answer_1: The colder seawater passing through the condenser tube bundles of the various stages increases evaporator vacuum.
Answer_2: The amount of heated feedwater discharged from the feedwater heater aftercondenser is increased.
Answer_3: Fewer noncondensable gases are created by the flow of colder seawater.
Answer_4: More seawater is allowed to pass through the first stage overflow weir.

Question_Title: Pipe friction during oil transfer will be the greatest during the transfer of a lubricating oil at 130°F with a viscosity index of __________.
To maintain the design discharge pressure of a centrifugal  pump, the clearance between the __________.
Answer_1: impeller and lantern ring is critical
Answer_2: impeller and casing wearing rings is critical
Answer_3: packing box and packing gland is critical
Answer_4: gland seal and packing gland is critical

Question_Title: A lantern ring is __________.
Answer_1: the bottom ring in a set of piston rings
Answer_2: the oil slinger on a spring bearing
Answer_3: used to distribute seal water throughout the pump stuffing  box
Answer_4: the lifting ring on each running light

Question_Title: Moisture in the refrigerant may __________.
Answer_1: freeze on the expansion valve seat and reduce the flow of liquid refrigerant
Answer_2: emulsify the oil in the condenser

Question_Title: Why would a flash type distilling unit be more efficient when operated in cooler seawater temperatures?
Answer_1: Steam carryover between stages is reduced.
Answer_3: The amount of available flash steam is decreased.
Answer_4: Feedwater flow from the feedwater heater is increased.

Question_Title: When comparing a bent-axis, axial piston, variable stroke hydraulic pump, to a variable angle tilting box, axial piston pump where the number, diameters, and rotating speed of the pistons are the same, the significant difference is the __________.
When using the draw file method, which of the listed types  of files will produce a fine finish?
The end joint formed by adjoining plates in a hull plating  strake is properly identified as a __________.
In which of the following descriptions would centrifugal pump impeller cavitation most likely occur if the impeller  diameters, rotating speed, and liquid temperature are the same?
Answer_1: In the second stage of a two-stage pump.
Answer_2: A single-stage impeller with straight vanes.
Answer_3: A single-stage impeller with curved vanes.
Answer_4: A two-stage pump with an operating speed 100 RPM less than  specified.

Question_Title: Which of the following precautions should be observed concerning the introduction of a fire resistant fluid into a hydraulic system?
Answer_1: Deterioration of paints, seals, metals, and electrical insulation may occur.
Answer_2: Fluid viscosity always increases as a normal result of its  use.
Answer_3: Decreased wear rates of components is an advantage of its use.
Answer_4: Only chemically active filters may be used.

Question_Title: Marine sanitation devices installed on vessels must be certified by the __________.
Answer_3: Society of Naval Architects and Marine Engineers

Question_Title: The condensers located in the various stages of a flash evaporator are cooled by __________.
When cutting external threads on a steel pipe with a die, you should __________.
Answer_1: start the die at a slight angle with the work to create tapered threads
Answer_2: tap the die with a hammer to break up the chips
Answer_3: continue turning until the end of the pipe has gone through the die and is flush with the die face

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions is most likely to cause water hammer in the potable water system?
Answer_1: The hydro-pneumatic tank being properly charged.
Answer_2: The starting of the potable water pump.
Answer_3: A low water level in the potable water storage tank.
Answer_4: Rapid closing of a spring closed basin faucet.

Question_Title: The welded joint located between two plates in the same strake of hull plating is called a __________.
The tendency of a flammable liquid to vaporize is indicated by its __________.
On many modern tankers, which of the following devices is used to reduce cargo pump leakage to the pump room bilge?
Moisture entering a typical refrigeration system will most  likely __________.
Answer_2: be removed by the liquid line strainers
Answer_3: cause sweating and frost on the evaporator coils

Question_Title: In a two stage flash distilling plant, which of the pumps listed is vented to the shell of the second stage in order  to remove vapor from the pump suction?
The component which is used to thoroughly separate small, fine, dust-like particulate contamination from hydraulic fluid is a/an __________.
Short cycling of the potable water pump is avoided by the proper use of a  __________.
Answer_1: hydro-pneumatic tank completely filled with compressed air  at system operating pressure
Answer_3: charge of air, at 20 psi (137.9 kPa) above system pressure  with the hydro-pneumatic tank one quarter full of water
Answer_4: charge of air, at system pressure, when the hydro-pneumatic tank is half full of water

Question_Title: Vertical structural members used to support and transmit downward forces of a load are called  __________.
Thermostatic steam pressure reducing valves are used in the fuel oil service system to control the __________.
Answer_1: double bottom fuel oil tank temperature
Answer_3: pressure of the fuel supplied to the burners
Answer_4: attemperator steam flow in the heater discharge circuit

Question_Title: When the propeller blades are integral with the hub, the propeller is called a __________.
The best gasket material to use in cargo fuel oil lines is  __________.
When fire safe or fire resistant fluid is to be used in a hydraulic system, it is important that __________.
Answer_1: the resultant pressure, due to the increase in fluid viscosity, is not excessive
Answer_2: the fluid does not dissipate too much heat
Answer_3: the fluid be compatible with all seal materials used
Answer_4: separate lube oil supply be furnished for the hydraulic pump

Question_Title: Moisture in a refrigeration system can cause __________.
The process of grinding, shredding, or reducing the size of sewage particles is known as __________.
In ship construction, which of the listed strengthening members act to support the decks?
The lowest temperature at which fuel combustion becomes self-sustaining in the presence of a source of ignition, is defined as the __________.
Which of the problems listed could be indicated if a sight  glass in the refrigerant liquid line is full of bubbles?
During routine maintenance the bilge manifold valves are removed.  Prior to resecuring the valve bonnets, the valve  __________.
Answer_1: disks and seats should be checked and lapped if necessary
Answer_2: bonnet, flange gaskets should be renewed if they were cut or torn
Answer_3: stem packing should be renewed if the packing has hardened, the glands have bottomed out, or the glands cannot be tightened

Question_Title: Vertical support members used to strengthen bulkheads are called __________.
Design characteristics of lubricating oil sump tanks will include __________.
Answer_1: installation of baffles to prevent excessive sloshing of oil
Answer_2: sufficient capacity to contain all the lube oil in the system except for the contents of the gravity tank
Answer_3: cooling coils made of welded seamless steel pipe
Answer_4: the bottom of the sump should be integral with the shell plating

Question_Title: When changing to a fire resistant hydraulic fluid in a system, it is important to check the compatibility of the new fluid with the system's __________.

Some refrigeration systems have chemical moisture indicators installed in conjunction with the sight glass in the liquid line.  If excess moisture is present in the system, the indicator will __________.
Answer_4: add a predetermined amount of liquid drier

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the functions of a reservoir used in a hydraulic system?
The advantages of flash type evaporators, as compared to submerged tube type evaporators, include __________.
Answer_1: less internal corrosion because of lower brine density
Answer_2: higher temperature evaporation for lower salinity of the distillate produced
Answer_3: less scale formation in a flash evaporator
Answer_4: less feedwater required for a flash evaporator

Question_Title: The aft, starboard bilge-well can not be pumped out, and back flushing has not been successful.  The next practical  solution will be to carry out which of the following actions?
Answer_1: List the ship to port in order to pump out the bilges for the remainder of the voyage.
Answer_2: Place 20 gals. (75.7 L) of fuel oil tank-wash into the affected bilge well for one hour to dissolve the stoppage.
Answer_3: Take all necessary steps to properly and safely pump out the affected bilge well, then manually 'muck' it out.
Answer_4: Change over and use one of the two remaining bilge pumps to dewater the starboard bilge well.

Question_Title: The double bottom in a vessel is a space comprised of __________.
Answer_1: plating forming the engine room tank top
Answer_2: doubler plating installed over the flat keel plate
Answer_3: a watertight boundary formed by the inner bottom
Answer_4: compartments between the inner and outer bottoms

Question_Title: Compared to a constant pitch propeller, a controllable pitch propeller __________.
Answer_1: more efficiently uses available engine power
Answer_2: operates at a lower efficiency at a fixed speed
Answer_3: produces the same torque at lower engine power
Answer_4: develops its rated power at a lower speed

Question_Title: A liquid indicator sight glass is useful in determining whether or not a refrigeration system is sufficiently charged.  It is generally located in the __________.
The tool best suited for cutting pipeline flange gaskets to the correct size is __________.
A hand hacksaw blade is normally installed in the saw frame with the teeth pointing away from the saw handle, because __________.
Answer_1: the blade will always break if installed otherwise
Answer_2: cutting fluid must flow down the teeth
Answer_3: the blade will overheat if installed otherwise
Answer_4: cutting pressure is most easily put on the forward stroke

Question_Title: One distinct advantage of flash type evaporators, as compared to most other evaporators, is that in a flash evaporator __________.
Answer_1: high temperature distillate can be recirculated to induce additional flashing
Answer_2: scale formation is not a severe problem
Answer_3: cold shocking is more effective in removing scale
Answer_4: water purity is greatly increased at high capacity

Question_Title: The bilge system is unable to pump out the aft starboard engine room bilge-well due to the bilge-well suction being  fouled.  With two feet of water over the top of the bilge-well, which of the following actions should be carried out?
Answer_1: Send the wiper into the bilge-well with a scoop and pail.
Answer_2: Remove the effected bilge manifold valve and attempt to back flush the line.
Answer_3: Simultaneously operate all available bilge pumps.
Answer_4: Transfer half the contents of a drum of degreaser into the  bilge well and pump out the bilge well with the system.

Question_Title: The purpose of swash bulkheads is to __________.
Answer_1: minimize the effect of a listing condition
Answer_3: separate cargoes in a common tank
Answer_4: reduce liquid movement within a tank

Question_Title: A vessel has a mean draft of 28 feet 08 inches.  If the TPI immersion is 50 and the final forward draft is 30 feet 00 inches, what will be the after draft after taking on nine hundred tons of fuel oil?
A hacksaw blade is normally placed in the saw frame with the __________.
Answer_1: maximum possible tension on the blade
Answer_2: teeth pointing away from the handle
Answer_3: blade tooth set adjusted for maximum cutting width
Answer_4: teeth angled toward the saw handle

Question_Title: Dual electro-hydraulic steering units usually operate __________.
Answer_1: with both pumps on line at the same time
Answer_4: only when the rudder is moved amidships

Question_Title: A vertical shaft having a rudder attached to its lower end  and having a yoke, quadrant, or tiller fitted to its upper  portion by which it may be turned, is the __________.

Answer_2: remove all hydraulic system pressure and bring the pneumatic pressure to the system's design pressure
Answer_3: increase the pneumatic pressure until the hydraulic system  reaches its design pressure

Question_Title: An increase in rotor clearances in a rotary pump will __________.

Answer_4: air providing better lubrication of internal components, found in Hydraulic Systems, than hydraulic fluids

Question_Title: A temporary Certificate of Inspection, Form CG-854, may be  issued to a self propelled cargo vessel __________.

Answer_4: under all of the above situations

Question_Title: If an air compressor is used to supply compressed air to outlets throughout the engine room and on deck of a vessel, the system is known as the __________.

Question_Title: Machine bolts are identified by their __________.
