The function of the springs used with channel or plate-type valves for reciprocating air compressors is to __________.
Answer_1: open the valves during downward strokes
Answer_2: provide positive closing of the valves
Answer_4: reduce air intake and exhaust pulsations

Question_Title: If a hydraulic system is in continuous operation, and is equipped with an air cooled heat exchanger, the fan should  __________.
Answer_1: be in continuous operation as long as the main pump prime mover is in operation
Answer_2: come on only after the main pump prime mover is secured
Answer_3: be controlled by a thermostat to maintain the oil temperature at less than 190°F (87.8°C)
Answer_4: never be needed, except when the ambient temperature exceeds 90°F (32.2°C)

Question_Title: Where should you expect to find striking plates?
Answer_1: In the bow of the ship at the waterline.
Answer_2: On the bottom of a fuel or ballast tank under the sounding  tube.
Answer_3: Under the counter above the propeller blade tips.

Question_Title: The part of the anchor windlass that engages the anchor chain for lifting is called the __________.
Air blowing from the intake air filter of an operating air  compressor indicates __________.
Answer_3: pulsations in the air distribution system
Answer_4: overloading of the air distribution system

Question_Title: Which of the listed valve types is typically used as inlet  and discharge valves on modern low pressure air compressors?
When any low pressure distilling plant is operated with less than the designed vacuum, the __________.
If a refrigeration crankcase compressor were short cycling  on the low pressure cutout switch, the cause might be that  the __________.
Heavy pressure on the ends of a file will cause the work surface to become __________.
Which of the valves listed will be cycled from fully open to fully closed when the handle is turned 90°?
Which of the following problems would be the probable cause for the faulty operation of a reciprocating air compressor  suction valve?
Answer_1: Carbon build up in the piston ring belt.
Answer_2: Faulty operation of a cylinder unloader.
Answer_3: Compressor operation in an area of high relative humidity.

Question_Title: In which of the listed hydraulic systems will the  installation of an oil cooler be necessary?
Answer_4: Internal combustion engine hydraulic starter system

Question_Title: While riding at anchor, the anchor chain should be secured  by the __________.
Which of the following problems could cause air to blow out through the inlet air filter of a running compressor?
A refrigeration unit will tend to short cycle when operating __________.
A vacuum is initially created in a flash type distilling plant by __________.
Answer_1: the flashing of the feed water
Answer_2: the condensation of the saltwater feed
Answer_3: air ejectors, eductors, or a separate vacuum pump

Question_Title: Most pump manufacturers recommend that the discharge piping for centrifugal pumps be one size larger than the pump discharge nozzle to __________.
Answer_2: reduce the frictional losses due to fluid flow
Answer_4: allow rapid venting of entrained air

Question_Title: On a medium pressure, differential piston, reciprocating air compressor, lubrication of the pistons/cylinders is usually accomplished __________.
Answer_4: lube oil flow from the bearing lube oil system

Question_Title: If the steam flow entering the evaporator steam supply orifice has a quality of 95%, which of the following statements would be true?
Answer_1: The steam at the outlet would obtain a higher degree of desuperheat.
Answer_2: The steam at the outlet would be at a higher superheat than when it is supplied at 100% quality.
Answer_3: The steam would obtain a lower absolute pressure than when  it is supplied at a quality of 100%.
Answer_4: The entrained moisture will become a totally saturated vapor prior to any superheat being acquired by the steam.

Question_Title: What color is used to indicate the last shot of anchor chain?
The principal purpose of an anchor windlass chain stopper is to __________.
Answer_1: tie off the warping head lines
Answer_2: absorb the brake thrust of the anchor windlass
Answer_3: hold the anchor chain while riding at anchor
Answer_4: lock the intermediate clutch shaft to the wildcat

Question_Title: Which of the following problems can result in below normal  pressure in the intercooler of an operating low pressure air compressor?
Answer_3: Leaking intake valves on the high pressure cylinder
Answer_4: Leaking discharge valves on the low pressure cylinder

Question_Title: If the supplied steam pressure to the first effect of a submerged tube distilling plant is allowed to fluctuate, the distiller __________.
If a refrigeration compressor is short cycling on high head pressure, you should __________.
Answer_1: purge the condenser if the waterside is dirty
Answer_2: check for proper water flow through the condenser
Answer_3: increase the high pressure cutout setting

Question_Title: Which of the listed tools should be used to remove a tapered roller bearing from a shaft?
Answer_2: A steel drift pin and hammer

Question_Title: Most pump manufacturers recommended that the discharge piping for centrifugal pumps be __________.
Answer_1: one size larger than the pump discharge nozzle
Answer_2: the same size as the pump discharge nozzle
Answer_3: one size smaller than the pump discharge nozzle
Answer_4: installed with a short radius elbow at the pump

Question_Title: If all of the air charge has been lost from a ship service  air receiver, the compressor mechanical unloading system will __________.
Answer_1: fail to work, and the drive motor will trip the circuit breaker as the compressor will be overloaded
Answer_2: fail to function as designed, but the compressor having no load will start  with little or no difficulty
Answer_4: Still function normally, but the safety interlock will stop the drive motor

Question_Title: If the fixed orifice in the evaporator steam supply line were to be removed, the steam pressure reducing valve located  upstream would __________.
Answer_1: be unable to maintain steam flow unless the proper range spring were to be installed
Answer_2: be suitable for maintaining the required steam flow under  all load conditions
Answer_3: handle the operation satisfactorily as the control orifice develops an impedance to the steam flow

Question_Title: Every automated machinery plant must have an 'engineer's assistance' alarm.  Power for this alarm should be taken from the __________.
Excessively low air pressure occurring in the intercooler of a reciprocating air compressor is caused by __________.
Answer_1: leaky discharge valves on the LP cylinder
Answer_2: leaky discharge valves on the HP cylinder

Question_Title: If you install a hydraulic hose on a unit and fail to leave sufficient room for expansion, which of the following problems will develop?
Answer_1: The hose may pull loose from its fittings.
Answer_2: The components connected by the hose will be damaged.
Answer_3: The hydraulic unit will fail to acquire any power.
Answer_4: The hydraulic fluid will overheat and breakdown.

Question_Title: The refrigeration compressor in a water cooled refrigeration system is short cycling on the high pressure cutout switch. One reason for this could be the __________.
Answer_2: high pressure cutout switch is improperly adjusted

Question_Title: In the operation of a flash type evaporator equipped with air ejectors, the air and noncondensable gases are evacuated directly from the __________.
Most pump manufacturers recommend that the suction piping dimension for centrifugal pumps be __________.
Answer_1: one size smaller than the pump suction nozzle
Answer_2: the same size as the pump  suction nozzle
Answer_3: one size larger than the pump suction nozzle
Answer_4: installed with a short radius elbow at the pump

Question_Title: One method of unloading a low pressure air compressor at start-up is accomplished by __________.
Answer_2: the use of a precharged accumulator
Answer_4: temporarily discharging to the air receiver

Question_Title: Hydraulic systems typically operated for intermittent service do not require the use of oil coolers and would include all of the following except _________?
Answer_4: Internal combustion engine hydraulic starter system

Question_Title: On tankers using hydraulic tank valve actuation, which of the listed valve types has the highest tendency to develop  leaks relative to the valve, and results in more frequent maintenance?
Slipping drive belts on a ship service air compressor is a  probable symptom of __________.
If you install a new hydraulic hose in a hydraulic system,  the hose must be long enough to allow for contraction to prevent __________.
Answer_1: failure of the hydraulic hose connection
Answer_3: friction in other areas of the hydraulic system

Question_Title: The refrigeration system compressor is short cycling on high head pressure when the sea water cooling temperature is 72°F.  In this situation, you should __________.
Answer_1: check for sufficient cooling water flow through the condenser
Answer_2: purge noncondensable gases from the receiver
Answer_4: completely purge the high pressure side of the system

Question_Title: The proper file for a finishing cut on soft metal, such as  brass, is the __________.
Which of the following statements about pump operations is NOT a correct statement?
Answer_1: In order for a fluid to be pumped, a fluid must be made to  flow.
Answer_2: A substance must be cold in order for it to be pumped.
Answer_3: The kinetic energy imparted by the pump can be used to force a liquid through a hydraulic system.
Answer_4: A pump must receive its energy from an external source.

Question_Title: Unloading of a low pressure, reciprocating, air compressor  at start-up can be accomplished by __________.
Answer_1: holding the L.P. discharge valve open
Answer_2: the use of a precharged accumulator
Answer_3: using a permanently enlarged clearance expansion volume
Answer_4: temporarily discharging back to the compressor intake

Question_Title: If one of the bilge manifold valves is prevented from seating, the __________.
Answer_1: bilge-well connected to that valve, plus the second bilge-well being pumped will be completely emptied
Answer_2: bilge system will lose vacuum, preventing other bilges from being pumped out
Answer_3: aftermost bilge-wells connected to that valve will siphon their contents to the forward bilge-wells

Question_Title: The location of a vessel's frame stations may be obtained from which of the listed drawings?
Which of the following precautions should always be carried out in drydock?
Answer_1: Liquids should never be transferred between tanks without  consulting the dock master.
Answer_2: If sea valves have been disassembled, all bonnets must be checked for leakage when the ship is refloated.
Answer_3: Before refloating, all sea chest strainers should be verified as having been replaced.

Question_Title: If an electric motor driven air compressor fails to start,  it may be due to a __________.
Machinery driving fuel oil transfer and fuel oil service pumps must be fitted with a remote means of stopping the machinery from __________.
The compressor in an air-cooled condensing  refrigeration system is short cycling on the high pressure  cutout switch.  A probable reason for this is the __________.
The efficiency of a flash type evaporator can be increased  by __________.
Answer_2: decreasing the absolute pressure of each stage
Answer_3: increasing the saltwater feed heater temperature
Answer_4: increasing the pressure at the spray pipe

Question_Title: Open end wrenches are __________.
An air compressor can be unloaded at start-up by __________.
Answer_2: relieving the intercooler pressure to the atmosphere
Answer_3: using an enlarged, permanently opened clearance expansion space

Question_Title: Which of the following actions should be taken FIRST if one bilge well of a multiple suction bilge system is unable to  be pumped out?
Answer_1: Open the bilge pump for inspection.
Answer_2: Remove each of the suction manifold valves.
Answer_3: Remove only the suction manifold valve to the affected bilge well.
Answer_4: Attempt to pump out another bilge well to determine if the  entire system is affected.

Question_Title: Why do roller bearings have higher loading capacities than  ball bearings?
Answer_1: They are installed with tighter clearances.
Answer_2: They are subject to less pitting and metal fatigue.
Answer_3: They have a greater tolerance for high speed applications.
Answer_4: They have a greater contact area.

Question_Title: With regards to fluid flow control, an advantage of pneumatic control systems over electrical control systems is __________.
Answer_1: practically no limit to the power available for a given system
Answer_4: continued control through temporary electrical power losses

Question_Title: The seat of a butterfly valve will most likely be constructed of __________.
Flexible hose under pressure in a hydraulic system will __________.
Answer_1: tend to twist about its long axis
Answer_2: expand in length and in diameter
Answer_3: contract in length and expand in diameter
Answer_4: flex at right angles to the applied pressure

Question_Title: The compressor in the ship service refrigeration system is  short cycling on the high pressure cutout switch.  The probable reason for this is the __________.
Answer_3: condenser is getting insufficient cooling water flow

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the relationship between flash point and ignition temperature?
Answer_1: Both are higher than normal burning temperatures.
Answer_2: The flash point is always higher.
Answer_3: The ignition temperature is always higher.

Question_Title: The wrench size for a 3/4 inch American National bolt is __________.
You are unable to pump out the aft starboard engine room bilge well that is fouled, with one foot of water over the  top of the bilge well, what action should be carried out?
Answer_1: Send the wiper into the well with only a scoop and pail.
Answer_2: Remove the bilge manifold valve and attempt to back flush the line.
Answer_3: Simultaneously operate all available bilge pumps.
Answer_4: It is only necessary to transfer half the contents of a drum of degreaser into the bilge well.

Question_Title: On tank vessels using an automatic tape wells, free movement of the tape is normally checked by __________.
If a refrigeration compressor will not start, the reason may be __________.
Answer_1: the pressure regulating valve is not closing
Answer_2: an excessive lack of refrigerant in the system

Question_Title: The lowest temperature required to cause self-sustained combustion of a substance independent of any outside source of ignition is called __________.
The purpose of the wearing rings used in a centrifugal pump is to __________.
Answer_1: prevent an internal explosion in the pump when it is overheated
Answer_2: enable a visual inspection of the pump while it is running
Answer_3: insure a proper alignment of the pump coupling to the driver
Answer_4: accomodate for friction between the impeller and the casing

Question_Title: The aft starboard bilge well is clogged, and back flushing  has not been successful.  The next practical solution would be to __________.
Answer_1: change the trim of the ship to port in order to pump out the bilges for the remainder of the voyage
Answer_2: place 20 gallons ( 75.7 L) of fuel oil tank wash into the affected bilge well to clear the blockage
Answer_3: properly and safely empty the well with a portable pump then manually muck it out

Question_Title: On tank vessels using an automatic tape well for gaging tanks, the hand clutch is used to __________.
Automatic control valves for steam service require periodic maintenance inspections because they __________.
Answer_1: are subjected to high compressive stress
Answer_2: are subjected to a wide range of temperatures and pressures
Answer_3: continuously throttle steam resulting in wire drawing and erosion of the valve
Answer_4: receive high pressure air from the pilot valve

Question_Title: Double cut files are most effective when used for __________.
When a refrigeration compressor motor fails to start, the FIRST thing that should be checked for is a __________.
Answer_2: low differential setting on the H.P. cutout
Answer_3: blown fuse in the motor circuit

Question_Title: Clearances between the impeller hub and casing of a centrifugal pump are checked with the use of __________.
Answer_2: an accurate set of feeler gages

Question_Title: Air compressors are equipped with unloading systems for the purpose of __________.
Answer_1: removing all but the frictional load during starting
Answer_2: relieving intercoolers of high temperature buildups
Answer_3: providing high starting torque in the drive motor
Answer_4: seating valve plates during compressor shutdown

Question_Title: The simplest method to use for determining if a centrifugal pump is operating as designed, is to __________.
Answer_1: closely observe the pump discharge temperature
Answer_2: close off the discharge valve, and watch for a rise in pressure
Answer_3: momentarily close off the suction valve, and watch for a rise in pressure
Answer_4: use a clamp on ammeter and compare the readings to past records

Question_Title: The pressure of an operating hydraulic system, as indicated by a pressure gauge, is a result of the fluid flow  overcoming __________.
Answer_3: the load applied to the system

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning butterfly valves is correct?
Answer_1: Special tools are required for lapping or grinding.
Answer_2: It is impossible to throttle flow with a butterfly valve.
Answer_3: To close the valve, it is only necessary to turn the handle a quarter of a turn.
Answer_4: The butterfly valve should never be used in a freshwater system.

Question_Title: If a large difference exists between the compressor discharge pressure and the pressure corresponding to the existing condensing temperature in a refrigeration system,  you should __________.
Answer_1: increase the flow of the cooling water through the condenser
Answer_2: adjust the high pressure cutout to maintain the desired pressure
Answer_3: open the hot gas bypass temporarily to reduce capacity
Answer_4: purge noncondensable gases to reduce the excess pressure

Question_Title: The names plug, bottom, and taper refer to __________.

One of three available centrifugal salt water service pumps is in operation with a sea water temperature of 50°F.  The  cooling temperature of all systems supplied by this pump appear to be high.  Therefore, you should __________.
Answer_1: only need to start a second pump and operate it in parallel
Answer_2: start a second pump and place it on line, close the discharge valve on the original pump and watch for a rise in the discharge pressure
Answer_3: after starting the second pump open the casing vent valve of the first pump, then secure the first pump
Answer_4: after starting the second pump secure the first pump and do nothing else with the salt water service system

Question_Title: Pressure in an operating hydraulic system is developed __________.
Answer_1: only by the pump as its primary function
Answer_2: by resistance to the fluid flow through the system
Answer_3: by the thermal input to the system's fluid
Answer_4: solely by the charge applied by the accumulators

Question_Title: On small passenger vessels, separation of machinery and fuel tank spaces shall be __________.
Answer_1: provided between each of these spaces by watertight and/or  vaportight bulkheads
Answer_2: separated from accommodation spaces by watertight and/or vaportight bulkheads
Answer_4: separated from accommodations spaces by non-continuous bulkheads

Question_Title: Which of the listed types of files is the best for producing a fine finish on metal?
The accumulation of air and other noncondensable gases in a refrigeration system will __________.
Answer_1: cause a loss of the liquid seal
Answer_2: create a vapor lock in the liquid receiver
Answer_4: cause foaming of the oil in the crankcase

Question_Title: Which pump installation would require an external source of sealing water?
Answer_1: Main circulator pump jacket water cooling

Question_Title: When the pressure on a compound gage is released, the gage  pointer is returned to zero psig by action of the __________.
Hand taps are provided in sets of three, with each being known as __________.
A lube oil filter can be used to remove most contaminants from lube oil.  A contaminant which will remain in the lube oil after filtering is __________.
When installing a hydraulic hose, which of the following precautions should be taken?
Answer_1: The hose should not be twisted.
Answer_2: The hose should be protected with a sleeve if it is subjected to rubbing.
Answer_3: There should be some slack in the hose.

Question_Title: Air entering an air-cooled refrigeration system is indicated by __________.
Which of the following files will produce the finest surface on a workpiece being finished filed in a lathe?
How often should cargo oil pump relief valves on tank vessels to be tested?
Answer_1: Prior to each cargo discharge operation.

Question_Title: In most horizontally split centrifugal pump casings, wearing rings are prevented from rotating by __________.
Answer_1: swelling the wearing rings into the casing
Answer_2: using wear rings with a larger than normal outside diameter and having the casing 'crush' them in place
Answer_3: using one dowel pin pressed into the side of the ring, then fitting the pin into a hole drilled into the side of the casing ring grove
Answer_4: using an extended lip formed on one half of the ring and using the upper casing half to trap the lip when the casing is reassembled

Question_Title: Pigtails, or siphons, are used to protect Bourdon tube-type gages from the direct exposure to steam by __________.
Answer_1: changing the direction of the steam flow
Answer_4: bleeding off a portion of the steam

Question_Title: Round split dies are usually adjustable to __________.
Answer_2: control the diameter of threads cut
Answer_3: to help start the die squarely on the round stock
Answer_4: allow threading up to a shoulder

Question_Title: Fluctuating pressures and temperatures in an evaporator will __________.
Answer_1: eliminate most of the scale formation in the first effect
Answer_2: increase the heat level in all effects

Question_Title: The presence of bubbles in a refrigeration system liquid line may __________.
Answer_4: carry moisture and lead to corrosion

Question_Title: A mill file is used to __________.
Answer_1: produce a very fine finish by draw filing
Answer_2: produce a coarse finish by push filing

Question_Title: Dirt should not be allowed to contaminate a grease lubricant because the __________.
Answer_1: dirt will cause corrosion of bearing
Answer_3: dirt is very abrasive when mixed with grease

Question_Title: The function of a centrifugal pump double volute casing is  to __________.
Answer_1: reduce radial thrust to the impeller
Answer_2: double the liquid velocity through the pump when compared to a single volute

Question_Title: Differential pressures can be measured with the use of a __________.
If you are cutting external threads by hand and you start the die at an angle, the threads will __________.
Answer_1: be out of round on the work
Answer_2: be cut crooked on the work
Answer_3: be rough, weak, and easily broken
Answer_4: straighten out after the third revolution

Question_Title: Which of the listed statements is a characteristic of the liquid charged power element used with thermostatic expansion valves?
Answer_1: At the designed operating temperature, the liquid refrigerant charge has changed to a vapor.
Answer_2: The liquid refrigerant tends to collect at the bellows or diaphragm and reduces the valve sensitivity.
Answer_3: The sensing bulb is empty of liquid refrigerant charge at the designed operating temperature.
Answer_4: The sensing bulb is never emptied of liquid refrigerant under normal operating conditions.

Question_Title: Rapid fluctuations in the shell pressure in a submerged tube distilling unit will cause __________.
Answer_1: increased heat levels in the entire unit
Answer_2: decreased priming and high salinity distillate
Answer_3: first effect scale formation to be reduced
Answer_4: priming in the last effect shell

Question_Title: Air trapped in a refrigeration system using a water-cooled  condenser is usually indicated by __________.
Answer_1: unusually high head pressure when compared to the existing  temperature of the liquid refrigerant
Answer_2: higher than normal liquid level in the receiver
Answer_3: unusually lower than normal discharge pressure when compared to the existing temperature of the liquid refrigerant
Answer_4: higher than normal liquid refrigerant temperature

Question_Title: Which of the following types of files will produce a fine finish when draw filing?
The valve best suited for throttling gas or liquid flow in a pipeline is the __________.
In order to properly remove air from the casing of a centrifugal pump when starting, the pump should have a __________.
Answer_4: vent valve attached to the casing at the top of the volute

Question_Title: The tool used in precision work to smooth or enlarge a slightly undersized hole, is called a __________.
Copper sheet metal that is to be used as a gasket, is usually annealed by heating it to a cherry red color, and then __________.
Scale accumulation on evaporator heat exchange surfaces __________.
Excessive circulation of the lubricating oil with the refrigerant in a refrigeration system will cause __________.
Answer_1: carbon deposits on the compressor suction valves
Answer_3: rapid corrosion of the thermal expansion valve

Question_Title: The first step when resetting the slide valves on a  duplex reciprocating pump is to __________.
Answer_1: position the steam pistons on 3/4 stroke
Answer_2: ensure the balance piston is on the downstroke
Answer_3: place the steam pistons in the mid stroke position
Answer_4: measure the present port openings to ensure reassembly will be the same

Question_Title: Which of the following centrifugal pump components converts the liquid kinetic energy of velocity to the potential energy of pressure?
If the air temperature in a manifold were found to be 122°F, what will be the equivalent reading on the centigrade scale?
An American Standard Tapered pipe thread has a taper of __________.
When replacing a gasket in a six-bolt flanged joint, in what order should the bolts be tightened?
Answer_1: Each bolt should be installed and tightened in consecutive order in the clockwise direction.
Answer_2: Each bolt should be installed and tightened in consecutive order in the counterclockwise direction.
Answer_3: Install and tighten bolts 1, 3, 4, 2, 5, and 6, in that order.
Answer_4: Install and tighten bolts in pairs which are opposite each  other in the flange (1-4, 2-5, and 3-6).

Question_Title: Sludge may form in the crankcase of an air conditioning compressor as a result of __________.
Answer_4: reducing the cloud or floc point

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning the 'flash point' of a liquid?
Answer_1: It is lower than the ignition temperature.
Answer_2: It is the temperature at which a substance will spontaneously ignite.
Answer_3: It is the temperature at which a substance, when ignited, will continue to burn.
Answer_4: It is the temperature at which the released vapors will fall within the explosive range.

Question_Title: The primary function of a centrifugal pump volute is to __________.
If your vessel burns 8 tons of fuel per hour at 15 knots,  how many tons per hour will it burn at 18 knots?
The complete tool used for manually cutting threads on pipe is called a pipe __________.
The purpose of the six-way valve used in an  electro-hydraulic steering system is to __________.
Answer_1: parallel rudder motion to the steering wheel
Answer_2: take the pump off stroke when desired rudder angle is attained
Answer_3: redirect hydraulic fluid flow when changing over pumps
Answer_4: ensure positive contact between the Rapson slide and the rudder post

Question_Title: Sludge may form in the lubricating oil crankcase of a reciprocating air conditioning compressor as a result of __________.
Answer_1: wax precipitation in the lube oil
Answer_2: contamination by dust, scale, or moisture
Answer_3: refrigerant bubbles in the lube oil
Answer_4: refrigerant reducing the lube oil viscosity

Question_Title: The second stage feedwater temperature and shell absolute pressure in a multistage, flash type, distilling plant is __________.
Answer_1: higher than the first stage feedwater temperature and absolute shell pressure
Answer_2: lower than the first stage feedwater temperature and absolute shell pressure
Answer_3: the same as the first stage feedwater temperature and absolute shell pressure
Answer_4: not related to the feedwater temperature and absolute shell pressure

Question_Title: The percentage of impurities in a specific fuel oil sample  is determined by __________.
Which of the following statements describes the actions of  an axial piston motor with a full deflection variable position tilting box?
Answer_1: Control over speed, direction, and stopping would be better than having the pump equipped with the tilting box.
Answer_2: Maximum speed when rotated in the 'hauling in' direction would be obtained with the tilting box just prior to neutral stroke, while 'pay out' would be the opposite.
Answer_3: Maximum torque, when rotated in the 'pay out' direction would be obtained with the tilting box just prior to neutral stroke, while 'hauling in' would be the opposite.
Answer_4: Maximum speed in either direction of rotation would be achieved just beyond of neutral stroke, making reversal of  direction difficult.

Question_Title: A ship travels 234.02 nautical miles in 24 hours at an average propeller speed of 60 RPM.  If the propeller pitch  is 20.07 feet, what is the propeller slip during this passage?
To avoid corrosion and/or oxidation of the element, a thermometer bulb is often protected by a 'well' or casing.  In addition to protecting the element, the 'well' will also __________.
Answer_1: cause consistently higher than actual readings
Answer_2: cause consistently lower than actual readings
Answer_3: require a longer time for the element to reach thermal equilibrium with the system being measured
Answer_4: increase the sensitivity of the element

Question_Title: Taps and dies used for threading pipe are __________.
Which of the following types of files is generally used for finishing?
Answer_4: Only a double bastard cut file

Question_Title: If the brine level of a double effect soloshell evaporator  is above the sight glass, which action should be taken?
Answer_1: Do nothing as this is the normal operating level.
Answer_2: The feed rate should be reduced and the brine discharge valve opened slightly.
Answer_3: The brine overflow weir should be raised to allow greater outflow.
Answer_4: The brine section should be drained down a minimum of 6 inches below the seawater heater bundle.

Question_Title: Sludge may be formed in the oil in the crankcase of a reciprocating air conditioning compressor as a result of __________.
Answer_1: refrigerant bubbles in the lube oil
Answer_2: refrigerant reducing the lube oil viscosity
Answer_3: oxidation of the lube oil from overheating
Answer_4: reducing the floc or cloud point of the oil

Question_Title: Small leaks in gaskets should be stopped immediately after  installation because __________.
Answer_1: the leak will probably worsen in time
Answer_2: the gasket may not seal itself for several hours
Answer_3: the leak will result in severe flange distortion
Answer_4: small leaks cause the pipeline to creep

Question_Title: The temperature of the steam flow to the saltwater feed heater, in a flash type evaporator can be manipulated by a/an __________.
Answer_1: pressure regulator within the supply orifice
Answer_3: attemporator in the steam supply piping
Answer_4: sensor wired in with the three-way salinity dump valve

Question_Title: Assume identical impeller diameter, width and speed.  Which of the following impellers will produce the greatest liquid velocity?
Answer_1: A single stage straight vane impeller
Answer_2: A single stage curved vane impeller
Answer_3: A dual integeral impeller unit operating at 10% lower speed
Answer_4: A dual impeller with multiple stepped curved vanes

Question_Title: With regards to axial piston hydraulic pump/motor power units, motor speed is a function of fluid flow rate generated by the pump.  Which of the following statements describes why the motor is NOT manipulated as is the pump?
Answer_1: The designers of the equipment have never considered the use of the tilting box with a hydraulic motor.
Answer_2: A comparable pump tilting box if used in a hydraulic motor, would eliminate the hydraulic lock to the system when the motor is placed in neutral stroke.
Answer_3: Reduction gears would be required if a hydraulic motor were designed with a tilting box.
Answer_4: A tilting box hydraulic motor could never produce more than one horsepower.

Question_Title: What characteristic can be applied to Refrigerant 134a  when compared to R-12?
Answer_2: It is not compatable with mineral based lubricants.
Answer_3: It is visible as a blue fog.

Question_Title: The tool used for cutting external pipe threads is called a pipe __________.
A reading of 0.625 inch on a micrometer with a 2 to 3 inch  range would be equal to __________.
Foaming of the oil in a refrigeration compressor crankcase  is caused by __________.
Answer_1: refrigerant boiling out of solution from the lube oil
Answer_2: liquid refrigerant flooding the compressor and system
Answer_3: lube oil viscosity being reduced by refrigerant dilution

Question_Title: To properly make and fit a new gasket to a flange, you should __________.
Answer_1: place the gasket over the flange and knock off the excess material with a lead mallet
Answer_2: remove excess gasket material by trimming with scissors or  tin snips

Question_Title: If the electric motor driving an air compressor fails to start, the cause may be a __________.

Answer_3: adjust the valve gear to manufacturer's specified measurements

Question_Title: When steel, cast iron, or other metals with surface scale are being turned, the first roughing cut should be taken __________.

Question_Title: The low pressure side of a refrigeration system is  considered to exist from the __________.

Question_Title: Positive displacement, helical gear pumps are well suited for pumping oil because __________.

Answer_2: helical gear pumps are essentially self-priming and produce high suction lift

Question_Title: The component of a refrigerating system in which the refrigerant vaporizes and absorbs heat is known as the __________.

Answer_3: combined as part of the distillate cooler
Answer_4: another term used to describe the vapor feed heater

Question_Title: The main bearings of a reciprocating air compressor are tapered roller bearings.  When mounted, these bearings are  given a 'cold' end clearance to __________.
Answer_2: allow for longitudinal expansion of the crankshaft as the unit warms up

Question_Title: Generally speaking, when using a twist drill to bore a hole in metal, the harder the metal, the greater should be the drill's __________.

Answer_4: throughput of the brine overboard pump

Question_Title: Any restriction in the instrument air piping of a pneumatic control system will __________.

Answer_3: reduce the transmitted air signal value

Answer_3: sudden evaporation of entrapped air from the refrigerant liquid

Question_Title: If the drive belts on an air compressor were squealing, you should fix them by __________.

Question_Title: Which of the listed pressure control valves would be used to permit the completion of one action of a hydraulic system before a second action would be permitted?

Question_Title: If a centrifugal bilge pump were continually operated with  the discharge valve closed the __________.

Answer_4: be sure no pressure exists in the line

Question_Title: For proper support when turning a long thin piece of work between lathe centers, you should use a __________.

Answer_1: maintain the absolute pressure difference between the first and second stages

Question_Title: A water line ruptures under pressure and floods the engine  room causing $(USA)30,000 damage to the machinery.  By law,  this must be reported to the __________.

Answer_4: tubular workpiece being parted between centers

Question_Title: The temperature of a refrigerant gas is the highest __________.
