Question_Title: The delivery rate of an axial-piston hydraulic pump is controlled by varying the position of the __________.
When welding with an oxyacetylene outfit, __________.
Answer_1: open the acetylene valve until the hose pressure is 26 PSIG
Answer_2: open the acetylene cylinder valve only 1/4 to 1/2 turn and  leave the wrench on the valve stem
Answer_3: a leaking hose must be repaired by binding with tape
Answer_4: a flashback of flame into the hose is normal

Question_Title: A reciprocating refrigeration compressor may be tested for  leaking discharge valves by stopping the compressor, turning the discharge service valve all the way in, and then turning the compressor over by hand.  If the discharge valves are leaking, the compound gage will show pressures __________.
Answer_1: rising and falling with each stroke

Question_Title: Small droplets of water entrained in the flashed vapor produced in a flash-type evaporator, are removed by the __________.
Which of the following terms could be applied to the simple definition 'the energy of motion'?
Reset control is also referred to as __________.
A computing relay is used in a pneumatic control system to  __________.
One of the disadvantages of screw-type positive displacement rotary pumps is that they have __________.
Answer_2: performance characteristics sensitive to viscosity change
Answer_3: low tolerance for entrained air and gases
Answer_4: low range of flows and pressures

Question_Title: In order to assure an output near the end of its compression stroke, the pressure developed in the high pressure cylinder of a reciprocating air compressor is __________.
Answer_1: the same as the line discharge pressure

Question_Title: If the discharge valves on a refrigeration compressor are leaking badly, the compressor should __________.
Answer_4: short cycle on the high pressure switch

Question_Title: In order to prevent salt water contamination of the distillate in a flash-type evaporator, it is important to provide a positive seal around the __________.
Reset control is also referred to as __________.
Increasing the speed of a centrifugal pump will result in an increase in its capacity.  Another means of increasing the  capacity of a centrifugal pump is to increase the __________.
Answer_1: diameter of the discharge piping, with all other factors remaining the same
Answer_2: diameter of the suction piping, with all other factors remaining the same

Question_Title: The purging of air from an electro-hydraulic steering gear  unit is necessary when __________.
Answer_1: changing over to hand pump operation
Answer_3: the system has been filled with new oil
Answer_4: the rudder angle indicator does not match the helm position

Question_Title: When it is necessary to start an axial piston hydraulic motor under conditions where the hydraulic fluid is colder  than the lowest temperature recommended for proper  operation, you should operate the system at __________.
Answer_1: minimum speed until the normal operating pressure is reached
Answer_2: neutral stroke until all of the air has been vented
Answer_3: no load until the normal operating temperature is reached
Answer_4: maximum torque to attain rapid warm-up

Question_Title: A twin-screw, rotary, positive displacement pump is provided with timing gears.  If it were possible to change the lead  (pitch) of the screws, which of the following statements would represent the true effect on the pump characteristics?
Answer_1: The longer the lead, the lower the flow rate.
Answer_2: The shorter the lead, the higher the pressure potential.
Answer_3: The longer the lead, the lower the axial velocity.
Answer_4: The shorter the lead, the higher the inlet pressure requirements.

Question_Title: The piston displacement rate of a reciprocating air compressor can be modified by changing the __________.
If a refrigeration system, equipped with a reciprocating compressor, has a solenoid valve that is leaking during the 'off' cycle, this could cause __________.
Answer_2: high superheat in the outlet coil

Question_Title: Excessive air leakage into the suction side of a centrifugal pump would be indicated by which of the following operational problems?
Answer_1: The pump delivers full capacity when started, but gradually slackens off to an abnormally low flow.
Answer_2: The pump packing gland overheats after short operating periods.
Answer_3: The motor overcurrent protective device continually shuts the pump down.
Answer_4: Pounding noises can be heard at the pump suction chest.

Question_Title: A mode of control, whereby the position of the final control element is linearly proportional to the rate of change of the controlled variable, is called __________.
A dented race in an antifriction bearing could be caused by __________.
Answer_4: vibration while the bearing is not in operation

Question_Title: While inspecting the steering system at sea, you should check for __________.
Answer_1: air bubbles in the sight glass
Answer_3: overtravel in the rudder angle indicator

Question_Title: How does the viscosity of a fluid being pumped affect the operation of a spur gear pump?
Answer_1: The viscosity of the fluid is relatively unimportant in the pump operation.
Answer_2: The pump can only be used for fluids of high viscosity.
Answer_3: The pump can only be used for light oils.
Answer_4: The pump cannot handle fluids more viscous than lubricating oil.

Question_Title: Which of the following forms of energy is demonstrated through the process of combustion?
If one box in a multiple box, direct expansion type refrigeration system was experiencing an excessively low temperature, this could be a result of __________.
Answer_1: liquid refrigerant returning to the compressor
Answer_2: excessive frost on the cooling coils

Question_Title: When securing an oxyacetylene cutting outfit for an extended period, you should close the __________.
Answer_1: hand valves on the torch only
Answer_3: cylinder valves and close torch valves with 4 to 5  pounds of pressure in the hoses
Answer_4: cylinder valves and close torch valves when pressure in hoses and regulators is zero

Question_Title: Pump efficiency may be lost as a result of __________.
Answer_1: air entering the pump through a pin hole leak in the discharge manifold
Answer_2: a leak in a gasket on the suction side of the pump
Answer_3: the suction valve in the wide open position
Answer_4: the pump being installed too close to the suction tank

Question_Title: A mode of control, whereby the speed of motion of the final control element is linearly proportional to the deviation of the controlled variable from set point, is called __________.

A solenoid, direct-acting, three-position, spring-centered, directional control valve is used in a hydraulic system to  control a linear actuator.  With the actuator under load there is no movement.  However, when the load is removed the actuator can be cycled in both directions, although slower  than normal.  Which of the statements listed is the probable cause?
Answer_1: One or both of the centering springs has broken and the spool has jammed in the valve body.
Answer_2: One or both of the solenoid coils has sustained an open.
Answer_3: The pump coupling is damaged and the pump is unable to attain its rated speed of rotation.
Answer_4: The pump coupling has sheared and the motor is overspeeding.

Question_Title: The capacity of a centrifugal pump can be increased by the  installation of a larger diameter impeller.  Another means  of increasing the pump capacity is to __________.
Answer_2: increase the size of the cardent assembly
Answer_4: change the pump to a 'close coupled' arrangement

Question_Title: While inspecting the steering gear at sea, you should check for __________.
Answer_2: accuracy of the rudder angle indicator

Question_Title: A spur gear pump should be operated with the discharge valves __________.
Which of the following forms of energy concerns the forces  which bind atoms together in a molecule?
Leaking suction valves in a refrigeration compressor are indicated by __________.
In an oxygen acetylene welding outfit, the torch tip orifice size __________.
Answer_2: determines the amount of acetylene and oxygen fed to the flames
Answer_3: can be varied by rotating the tip
Answer_4: depends on the regulator flow rate

Question_Title: Which of the following conditions would be hazardous if you were using two centrifugal pumps to discharge a flammable liquid?
Answer_1: Both pumps operating at the same speed and discharging into a common line.
Answer_2: Each pump operating at a different speed and discharging into a common line.
Answer_3: Both pumps operating at the same speed taking suction from a common line.
Answer_4: Each pump operating at a different speed and taking suction from a common line.

Question_Title: Greases are generally produced by __________.
Answer_1: reducing the temperature of an oil below its cloud point to create the gelatinous texture
Answer_2: saponifying a metal base, to which oil is then added and mixed under controlled temperature
Answer_3: reducing tallow 50°F below its pour point then mixing a base metal, such as barium, into solution
Answer_4: saponifying an aluminum base, to which tallow and oil are mixed into solution under a controlled temperature

Question_Title: The oil in a cargo winch gear box should be sampled periodically to __________.
Answer_1: prevent the gear box from leaking
Answer_2: prevent the oil from becoming inflammable
Answer_3: make sure it has not become contaminated
Answer_4: make sure the motor bearings are lubricated

Question_Title: When the steering gear is in operation, you should __________.
Answer_1: check hydraulic oil levels every hour
Answer_3: check for excessive oil leakage from rams
Answer_4: drain water from telemotor cylinders each watch

Question_Title: What class of screw thread is indicated with a machine screw described as 1/2-13 NC-2?
The capacity of a rotary pump, delivering a constant viscosity fluid, will decrease when the discharge pressure  is increased, due to __________.
Which of the following forms of energy is usually associated with the motion of large bodies or objects?
A refrigeration system is equipped with a reciprocating compressor and a water cooled condensing unit.  If the system is overcharged, the resulting high head pressure will be caused by __________.
Answer_1: the expansion valve overfeeding the evaporator
Answer_3: an incorrectly adjusted high pressure cutout

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning braze welding  is/are correct?
Answer_1: Braze welding is an exceptionally good method of repairing  malleable (special heat-treated) iron.
Answer_2: A braze welded joint should be cooled immediately with cold water or forced air draft to reduce the intensity of the heat path.
Answer_3: Repairs to working parts or containers used in chemical processes, especially strong alkaline solutions, are effectively accomplished with braze welding.

Question_Title: If it were necessary for you to frequently replace the packing on the main condensate pump, the trouble could be the result of __________.
Answer_1: running at low speed for a long time

Question_Title: Which indicator is used to determine the hardness of a grease?
Winch gears must be maintained in proper alignment to prevent __________.
If a hydraulic pump is producing a noisy whine when in operation, the cause may be __________.
Answer_1: an air leak in the pump suction line above the oil level in the reservoir
Answer_2: low viscosity in the hydraulic fluid
Answer_3: an oil leak across the pump shaft packing
Answer_4: due to the wrong direction of rotation of the hydraulic motor

Question_Title: When using a deflecting beam torque wrench, the torque is __________.
Answer_1: read on a scale mounted on the handle of the wrench
Answer_2: read on a dial mounted on the handle of the wrench
Answer_4: indicated by a release or break of the handle

Question_Title: The capacity of a rotary pump, when operated at a constant  speed, will decrease with an increase in the pump __________.
Which of the following statements represents the definition of energy?
Answer_1: Energy is work that has been accomplished.
Answer_2: Energy is the capacity for producing an effect.

Question_Title: An excessive charge of refrigerant in an air-cooled refrigeration system can cause __________.
Answer_2: higher than normal suction and discharge pressures with a higher box temperature
Answer_3: higher than normal discharge pressure with a normal box temperature

Question_Title: With reference to the oxyacetylene welding of high carbon steels, hard-facing, and the welding of nonferrous alloys,  such as monel, the best flame to use is termed a/an __________.
Excessive wear on a centrifugal pump shaft sleeve will __________.
Answer_1: cause severe vibration when the pump is operating
Answer_2: cause excessive leakage past the packing gland
Answer_3: cause damage in the stuffing box
Answer_4: allow interstage leakage in the pump casing glands

Question_Title: Who is responsible for completing the Muster List ("Station Bill") or muster list and posting it in a visible area aboard the vessel?
Inspection of a low pressure gear pump for cavitation will  usually be indicated by a wear pattern __________.
Answer_1: along the inlet side of the housing
Answer_2: along the discharge side of the housing
Answer_3: at the extreme upper and lower peripheries of the housing
Answer_4: even throughout the entire periphery of the housing when matched machined gear sets are used

Question_Title: When renewing sections of pipe in a hydraulic system, the nominal pipe size of the piping always indicates the __________.
The output volume of a positive fixed displacement pump can be changed only by __________.
Answer_1: changing the angle of the tilting plate
Answer_2: changing the speed of the pump
Answer_3: moving the slide block and rotor

Question_Title: Which of the conditions listed may be an indication of an excessive amount of refrigerant circulating through the system?
When welding or burning with a oxygen-acetylene, the acetylene working pressure must not exceed __________.
Excessive wear on a centrifugal pump shaft sleeve will __________.
Answer_1: cause new packing to be torn and scored
Answer_2: cause severe pump vibration at operating speed
Answer_3: damage the packing gland stuffing box
Answer_4: damage the pump casing interstage seals

Question_Title: The mode of control employed by an alarm circuit is a __________.
If you are given the job of adding hydraulic fluid to a mooring winch, and are not certain as to the type of fluid  to use, you should __________.
Answer_1: add fluid that is the same color as the fluid in the reservoir
Answer_2: add turbine oil because it is always a good substitute
Answer_3: add any oil that has the same viscosity as the hydraulic fluid
Answer_4: check the winch manufacturer's instruction book

Question_Title: A gradual decrease in the discharge pressure of an operating hydraulic pump can be caused by __________.
Answer_1: the four-way control valve failing to shift
Answer_2: the bleeder valve sticking in the open position
Answer_4: a clogged air vent filter on the oil reservoir

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the proper operation of a three-way solenoid trip/dump valve on a two stage flash-type evaporator?
Answer_1: The valve must be manual reset.
Answer_2: The valve will trip if the sea water feed temperature drops below 175°F.
Answer_3: The valve is interlocked to trip only on de-energization of the solenoid.
Answer_4: The valve will trip if the distillate is too warm.

Question_Title: The rate of heat transfer from a hot region to a cold region is affected most by the __________.
Which of the conditions listed is one indication of an excessive amount of refrigerant in the system?
When replacing a steam pressure reducing valve, what information is required for the selection?
Answer_3: Maximum and minimum continuous flow rates (lbs./hr.)

Question_Title: The meat box temperature control circuit, as used in the ship service refrigeration system, is an example of __________.
Who is responsible for ensuring that someone is assigned to close the watertight doors in an emergency?
If the pump in a hydraulic system produces a low rumbling noise while in operation, this is a probable indication of  __________.
A three-way solenoid operated dump valve installed on a flash-type evaporator unit, will divert impure distillate to the bilge __________.
Answer_1: only if the cell selector switch is positioned to monitor the first stage distillate outlet
Answer_2: only if the cell selector switch is positioned to monitor the final stage distillate outlet
Answer_3: regardless of the cell selector switch position
Answer_4: only if power to the salinity panel is interrupted

Question_Title: Operating a rotary gear pump far below its rated speed when handling low viscosity liquids, will cause its volumetric efficiency to __________.
Answer_1: increase steadily as the moving gears develop less vibration
Answer_2: decrease to where the pump no longer develops flow
Answer_3: remain unchanged due to its positive displacement characteristics
Answer_4: fluctuate due to the amount of slip variation

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning heat transfer?
Answer_1: Heat is given off from a high temperature region known as a heat sink.
Answer_2: Heat transfer rate is affected most by the size of the heat sink involved.
Answer_3: Heat transfer rate is affected most by the temperature difference between the heat source and the heat sink.
Answer_4: Heat transfer by radiation will occur only by mass motion of a fluid substance.

Question_Title: When a refrigeration compressor has developed a high head pressure as a result of a refrigerant overcharge, you should __________.
Answer_1: increase the amount of cooling water to the condenser
Answer_2: decrease the amount of cooling water to the condenser
Answer_3: add more refrigerant to the system
Answer_4: remove some refrigerant from the system

Question_Title: On tank vessels equipped with power operated cargo tank valves, the type of power operator most commonly used is __________.
Excessive wear on the packing rings nearest the pump packing gland, while the rings nearest the impeller remain in good  condition, is caused by __________.
Answer_1: failure to insert and individually seat the rings, one ring at a time
Answer_2: insufficient tightening of the packing gland
Answer_3: failure to tighten the packing gland in a single adjustment
Answer_4: cutting the rings nearest the gland too short

Question_Title: Which of the following elements is common to all indicating instruments?
Leakage of hydraulic fluid from around the shaft of a hydraulic motor may be caused by __________.
Answer_3: high level in the oil sump

Question_Title: In a flash-type evaporator, an electrical salinity cell would be installed in the __________.
Answer_1: distillate outlet from the distillate cooler
Answer_2: distillate inlet to the distillate cooler
Answer_3: condensate drains from the distiller feedwater heater

Question_Title: If the viscosity of the liquid being transferred remains constant as the discharge pressure increases, the rotary pump __________.
When metal is tempered, it becomes __________.
If the suction pressure at the refrigeration compressor is below normal, the cause can be __________.
Answer_4: due to short cycling of the compressor

Question_Title: On tank vessels, which of the listed valve types is most commonly used in conjunction with hydraulically actuated controls?
'Offset' is an inherent characteristic of which of the following types of control modes?
If dirt is allowed to contaminate the sump of a hydraulic deck crane, which of the following problems will occur?
Answer_1: All the seals in the hydraulic lines will immediately blow out.
Answer_2: The lifting capacity of the crane will be immediately reduced by 70%.
Answer_3: The sheathing on the hydraulic lines will fracture.
Answer_4: The internal parts of the pump and hydraulic motor will wear excessively.

Question_Title: Where would a salinity cell be installed in a double-effect  distilling plant?
Which of the listed conditions will occur if the discharge  pressure of a rotary pump is increased from the designed 50 psi to 300 psi, while maintaining the same RPM?
Answer_1: The pump capacity will be decreased.
Answer_2: The pump capacity will be increased.
Answer_4: Internal liquid slippage will be reduced.

Question_Title: Reheating a hardened component to a temperature lower than  the hardening temperature and then cooling it is known as __________.
If the suction pressure for an operating refrigeration compressor is below normal, the cause may be __________.
The flame screens installed on sewage system tank vents prevent explosions by __________.
Answer_1: allowing the escape of flammable vapors
Answer_2: dissipating the heat of a fire
Answer_3: absorbing any flammable vapors in the vicinity
Answer_4: preventing flammable vapors from entering the tank

Question_Title: One of the many problems occurring with centrifugal pump shaft packing is the excessive wear on the rings nearest the packing gland. If the rings nearest the impeller remain in  good condition during the same operating period, the wear is most likely caused by __________.
Answer_1: insufficient lubrication of the lantern ring
Answer_2: packing rings rotating in the stuffing box
Answer_3: overtightening the packing in one adjustment
Answer_4: some rings being cut too short

Question_Title: Which of the following definitions can be used to define the term 'offset' as a characteristic of controller action?
Answer_1: The period of time in which the set point and the control point coincide.
Answer_2: The periodic change between the set point and the control point.
Answer_3: The variable difference between the set point and the control point.
Answer_4: The constant difference between the set point and the control point.

Question_Title: When a new section of shell plating is being installed, the proper weld sequence must be followed to __________.
Answer_1: minimize shrinkage stresses and harmful distortion
Answer_2: ensure that all weldments are downhand
Answer_3: provide the greatest restraint in the weld
Answer_4: ensure all horizontal weldments are completed first

Question_Title: A salinity indicator is used to determine the __________.
In order to tighten the bolts of a crankpin bearing to the  exact tension specified by the engine manufacturer, you should use a/an __________.
Which of the conditions listed could cause excessively low  refrigerant pressure at the compressor suction?
Answer_1: Insufficient flow of condenser cooling water.
Answer_2: The system is low on refrigerant.
Answer_3: The solenoid valve to the chill box is 'frozen' in the open position.
Answer_4: The high pressure cutout switch is inoperative.

Question_Title: Oil sprays on to a hot piece of machinery, catches fire and causes $35,000 damage to your vessel.  By law this must be reported to the __________.
Answer_2: Officer in Charge, Marine Inspection at the first port of  arrival
Answer_3: principal surveyor of the American Bureau of Shipping at the next U.S. port
Answer_4: U.S. Salvage Association Survey at the next U.S. port

Question_Title: Which of the following definitions best describes sensitivity as a characteristic of controller action?
Answer_1: The ratio of the output in response to a specified change to the input which caused it.
Answer_2: The steady state difference between the control point and the value of the controlled variable corresponding to the set point.
Answer_3: The variation of the manipulated variable produced by the mode of control.
Answer_4: The time difference between the input change and the output change of the controller.

Question_Title: If the relief valve on the discharge side of a hydraulic pump lifts, the cause could be __________.
Answer_1: a low load on the unit
Answer_3: a blockage in the line between the pump and hydraulic motor
Answer_4: the hydraulic motor turning too fast

Question_Title: A welding electrode is marked E-6010, this designation means that __________.
Answer_1: the electrode may be used in the flat position only
Answer_2: the minimum tensile strength of the weld metal will be 70,000 psi
Answer_3: either insulated or uninsulated electrode holders may be used
Answer_4: the electrode is to be used for shielded metal arc welding

Question_Title: Before power to a lathe is turned on, it is a good shop practice to first hand feed the carriage to ensure  __________.
Answer_3: all locking devices have been released
Answer_4: the workpiece is secure in the lathe

Question_Title: In an operating, water-cooled, multi-box refrigeration system, both low discharge and high suction pressures are being simultaneously experienced.  The probable cause for this condition is a/an __________.
Answer_1: overcharge of refrigerant in the system
Answer_3: improper superheat adjustment on the low side
Answer_4: discharge relief valve leaking back to the suction side

Question_Title: Charring or glazing of the inner circumference of the packing rings in a centrifugal pump, is caused by __________.
Answer_2: failure to seat the packing rings

Question_Title: A mandatory characteristic of a pure amplifier is that __________.
Answer_1: the form of the input and output energies must be the same
Answer_2: the ratio of the output to the input must always be greater than the numerical value of 'one'
Answer_3: the form of the input and output energies must be different
Answer_4: the action must be either integral or derivative

Question_Title: A grease drop point is __________.
Answer_1: how far a standard metal cone will penetrate into the sample in five seconds when dropped
Answer_2: how uniform and thick the spread of an ounce of grease is when dropped from a height of five feet
Answer_3: the temperature that a sample of grease begins to liquefy
Answer_4: the length of time a 50 gram sphere will be held in place from the underside of a surface coated with 25 millimeters  of the grease sample

Question_Title: A drill that wobbles while the drill press is in operation  may __________.
Answer_3: have been placed in the chuck off center

Question_Title: Setting the relief valve opening pressure in a hydraulic system lower than the required operating pressure will result in __________.
Answer_1: accelerated action of the system components

Question_Title: The high strength structural steel, such as Grade DH 32, when used as part of the main deck plating, is noted on the vessel's Certificate of Inspection.  The information is important because __________.
Answer_1: the properties of DH 32 steel may interfere with the operation of some cathodic protection systems
Answer_2: the properties of DH 32 steel will affect the ability to properly ground electrical apparatus in the immediate area
Answer_3: any electrical equipment mounted on DH 32 steel plating is  required to be insulated from the plating and internally grounded instead
Answer_4: the welding of any DH 32 steel requires special welding procedures

Question_Title: Large size pipe can be easily rotated with a __________.
If a refrigeration compressor had developed a high suction  pressure, the problem could be a result of __________.
Answer_1: a minor accumulation of air or noncondensable gases in the  system
Answer_4: liquid refrigerant flooding back from the cooling coil

Question_Title: If you have to completely grind a new point on a high speed drill, which of the following could happen if it is cooled  in cold water immediately after grinding?
Answer_2: The 59° angle will be lost due to metal contraction.
Answer_3: Cracks may appear in the metal.
Answer_4: The cutting surface will become annealed by the cold water.

Question_Title: A pure transducer utilizes __________.
Steam tables can be used to obtain the __________.
Answer_1: values for properties of water and vapor at various conditions
Answer_2: specific fuel consumption under steady steaming conditions
Answer_3: steam generating capacity of a vessel's boilers
Answer_4: mechanical efficiency of the main unit

Question_Title: The rate of heat transfer between the hot and cold fluids  passing through a shell-and-tube type heat exchanger will  __________.
Answer_1: remain constant along the tube's length
Answer_2: be greatest in a single pass counter flow heat exchanger
Answer_3: remain constant throughout the heat exchanger
Answer_4: vary from section to section through out the heat exchanger

Question_Title: A tool used for measuring, or laying out angles is called a __________.
A coolant is usually used when cutting metal in a power hacksaw to prevent the __________.
If a refrigeration compressor had a higher than normal suction pressure, the problem could be a result of __________.
Answer_1: a minor accumulation of air or noncondensable gases in the  system
Answer_4: a slightly higher than normal liquid level in the receiver

Question_Title: A pneumatic pressure tank is installed in a sanitary system to __________.
Answer_1: reduce excessive cycling of the sanitary pump
Answer_2: prevent the sanitary pump from losing suction
Answer_3: provide a higher pressure in the system then the pump can deliver
Answer_4: increase water flow through the system

Question_Title: One of the many troubles occurring with centrifugal pump shaft packing is the excessive wear on the rings nearest the packing gland, while the rings nearest the impeller remain  in good condition.  This wear may be caused by __________.
Answer_1: air entrained in the fluid pumped
Answer_2: packing rings rotating in the stuffing box
Answer_3: some packing rings being cut too short
Answer_4: improper adjustment of the gland nuts

Question_Title: While calibrating a bourdon tube pressure gage, all readings are found to be 10 pounds higher throughout its entire range.  An adjustment should be made by __________.
Answer_1: increasing the sector to pivot point length
Answer_2: resetting the pointer on its shaft
Answer_3: decreasing the sector to pivot point length

Question_Title: Return lines to hydraulic systems reservoirs should________.
Answer_1: end the return line as far as practicable from the pump  suction
Answer_2: end the return line as close to the pump suction as possible
Answer_3: provide a "P" or "S" trap in the return line as close to  the reservoir as possible to trap sediment from entering the tank
Answer_4: connect the return lines directly to the cleanout and inspection plates to limit the number of openings on the reservoir

Question_Title: The temperature differential occurring between the inlet temperature of the fluid to be cooled and the outlet temperature of the cooling medium in a shell-and-tube heat exchanger is greatest in which of the flow designs listed?

The designation E7028-A1 is typically located on an arc welding electrode.  Which of the listed letters and/or digits correctly identifies the welding position for which  the electrode is recommended?
The center head of a combination square set is used to __________.
Answer_3: locate the center on round stock
Answer_4: check the angle of thread cutting tools

Question_Title: A pipe or Stillson wrench should only be used on __________.
High suction pressure to a refrigeration system compressor  is caused by __________.
Answer_1: the expansion valve is insufficiently opened
Answer_2: the expansion valve being open too wide
Answer_3: the king valve is insufficiently open

Question_Title: Which material can be drilled at the highest speed?
Why is it necessary to spin the piston of a dead weight gage tester while carrying out the calibrations of pressure gages?
Answer_2: Eliminate the formation of air bubbles.
Answer_3: Prevent the piston rod from sticking.
Answer_4: To assist in calibrating the dead weight tester.

Question_Title: The general purpose of a heat exchanger is to __________.
Answer_1: eliminate hot air from the condenser
Answer_2: maintain steady pressure in a system
Answer_3: heat, or cool one fluid by means of another fluid
Answer_4: reduce the engine room temperature in tropical climates

Question_Title: To ensure a good weld, post heating is required whenever an arc weld repair is made __________.
Answer_4: to a part of the ship's main structure

Question_Title: To get an accurate measurement using a 12 inch machinist's  steel rule, you should measure __________.
Answer_1: from the one inch graduation mark
Answer_2: from the zero end on the scale
Answer_3: on the narrow edge of the rule
Answer_4: on the unmarked edge of the rule

Question_Title: A pipe, or Stillson wrench functions best when __________.
Answer_1: the bite is taken midway up the jaw teeth
Answer_2: the wrench jaws are at the widest open setting
Answer_3: a maximum pull is exerted with one hand
Answer_4: an extension is placed on the wrench handle

Question_Title: Which of the following problems could cause the high pressure cutout switch to shut down the compressor in a refrigeration system?
Which of the following procedures is used to bring a hole to finished size with high accuracy?
A crackling noise coming from a centrifugal pump casing is  an indication of __________.

When a bourdon tube pressure gage is tested and found to be inaccurate, adjustment must be made to obtain the correct readings.  The distance between the pointer spindle and the link connection to the sector gear will be changed when the __________.
Answer_1: pointer does not travel the correct distance as test weight is added
Answer_2: proportional amount of pointer travel for each weight added is correct, but the total reading is wrong
Answer_3: reading is correct only at the working pressure
Answer_4: readings are correct only at the minimum and maximum ends of the scale

Question_Title: The heat required to raise the temperature of a unit mass of a substance one degree is called its __________.
Which of the following statements represents a disadvantage associated with a spool-type, solenoid direct operating, directional control valves?
Answer_1: Back pressure on the outlet line must be steady to drain the lower spool chamber.
Answer_2: The valve sealing surface is often damaged through excessive throttling action.
Answer_3: The spool does not have hydrocushion capabilities to handle shock.
Answer_4: Close fitting spools occasionally stick due to the accumulation of hydraulic oil residues.

Question_Title: Needle nosed pliers are best used to __________.
Answer_1: strip insulation from electric wire or cable
Answer_2: perform work in tight places ordinary pliers cannot

Question_Title: If the water failure switch should fail to shut down the refrigeration compressor, the refrigerant pressure will build up in the high pressure side of the system to the point where the __________.
Answer_1: compressor discharge valves would be damaged
Answer_4: high pressure cutout switch would function

Question_Title: Which of the following surfaces will not develop a  hydrodynamic film where motion is accompanied by any appreciable loading?
Answer_4: All of the above surfaces will sustain a hydrodynamic film  while in motion under a load

Question_Title: If you heard a 'crackling' noise in a centrifugal pump, the most probable cause of the problem would be __________.
A proportional band, or range adjustment of a bourdon tube  pressure gage is accomplished by __________.
Answer_1: adjusting the effective moment arm length between the bourdon tube and the quadrant gear fulcrum
Answer_2: adjusting the pointer position relative to the shaft on which it is mounted
Answer_4: flattening the cross-section of the bourdon tube

Question_Title: An electric motor driven (torque producing) remotely controlled, valve actuator is installed on the high sea suction with the 'red' indicator light illuminated.  When the 'open' push button is depressed, the 'green' indicator light comes on momentarily and then goes out, without any appreciable movement of the valve.  Which of the following actions should be carried out?
Answer_1: Alternately depress the 'close' and 'open' buttons to get  the valve open.
Answer_2: Manually engage the actuator handwheel and 'break' the valve disk from its seat, then push the 'open' button.
Answer_3: Secure power, tag out system and make repairs because the  valve stem has sheared.
Answer_4: Secure the breaker to this device, then switch the motor leads and push the 'open' button.

Question_Title: The unlicensed crew requirements listed on the Certificate  of Inspection reads as follows:  3 firemen/watertenders; 3  oilers.  The vessel is about to depart on a foreign voyage, and has in the crew: 3 firemen/watertenders, 2 oilers, and  one man, whose merchant mariner's document is endorsed QMED, any rating.  You should __________.
Answer_1: call the port captain and request another oiler
Answer_2: sail because your crew requirements are filled
Answer_3: request a waiver from the Coast Guard
Answer_4: check if any of the firemen have enough time for an oiler's endorsement

Question_Title: Which of the following problems will occur if the internal  drain at either end of a hydraulic, two-way, spool-type directional control valve cylinder were to become plugged?
Answer_1: The reservoir would become vapor bound.
Answer_2: The valve would be placed in hydraulic lock.
Answer_3: The spring loaded relief ports would open.
Answer_4: The buffering chambers would be unable to function.

Question_Title: Which of the devices listed can be used to measure any angle on a blueprint or drawing?
A bronzed sleeve is secured to the propeller tailshaft by __________.
An increasing head pressure in a refrigeration system, without any corresponding change in the cooling water inlet temperature, would probably be caused by __________.
Answer_2: air and noncondensable gases in the condenser
Answer_4: flooding back of liquid refrigerant from the evaporator

Question_Title: The set point adjustment of a bourdon tube pressure gage is accomplished by __________.
Answer_1: adjusting the effective moment arm length between the bourdon tube and the quadrant gear fulcrum
Answer_2: adjusting the pointer position relative to the shaft on which it is mounted
Answer_3: adjusting the pointer position by bending the free end of the pointer
Answer_4: flattening the cross section of the bourdon tube

Question_Title: Prolonged operation of a hydraulic pump in a cavitating condition can cause __________.
Answer_1: the hydraulic fluid to become overheated
Answer_2: the fluid motor to become overloaded
Answer_4: a wide variation in fluid pressure surges

Question_Title: If you were uncertain as to what type of gasket material to install in a pipeline, you should __________.
Answer_1: turn the old gasket over and install it again
Answer_2: check the ship's plans or manufacturer's instructions
Answer_3: leave the old gasket in and cover it with Permatex
Answer_4: make up the joint without a gasket until you can check with the chief

Question_Title: If the refrigeration compressor was developing higher than  normal discharge pressure, this could be a result of __________.
Answer_1: air or noncondensable gases in the system
Answer_4: liquid refrigerant flooding back from the cooling coil

Question_Title: The tailshaft is usually supported by the __________.
Frequent bearing replacement in a centrifugal pump, due to  rapid bearing wear, can be a result of __________.
Answer_1: leakage through the pump stuffing box gland

Question_Title: Which of the following control modes is generally not used  by itself?

During the repair and overhaul of the pump relief valve, used in a hydraulic system, the set point was reduced by 100 psi.  Which of the following statements describes the result of the set point being lowered?
Answer_1: The pump discharge pressure will remain at the same pressure prior to the relief valve being repaired.
Answer_2: The solenoid controlled, three-position, spring centered control valve response will be quicker.
Answer_3: The fluid viscosity will increase during operation.
Answer_4: The movement of any system actuator will now be slower.

Question_Title: A drop test is carried out on a sample of grease by __________.
Answer_1: allowing a suspended cone to drop into a sample of grease for five seconds and determining the depth of penetration
Answer_2: dropping a one ounce grease sample from one meter, and observing the resulting spread pattern, uniformity of thickness, and consistency of texture
Answer_3: allowing a sample of grease to drop into a cup at ambient temperature and determining the time necessary for this to  occur
Answer_4: determining the temperature at which a grease sample liquefies when heated and drops from a cup through a bottom orifice

Question_Title: Cavitation in a hydraulic pump is indicated by noisy pump  operation and can be caused by a/an __________.
Answer_1: high fluid level in the reservoir
Answer_3: excessive discharge pressure from the pump
Answer_4: clogged suction strainer in the reservoir

Question_Title: When welding mild steel with a shielded metal-arc electrode, and getting only shallow penetration, you should __________.
The three basic parts of any eductor are the nozzle, the suction chamber, and the __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning the hydrodynamic wedge developed by lubricating oil?
Answer_1: The wedge-shaped oil film's load carrying capacity is determined by its length and thickness.
Answer_2: The load carrying capacity is inversely proportional to the velocity of the fluid.
Answer_3: Pressures throughout the oil wedge are uniform.
Answer_4: The load carrying capacity is directly proportional to the  thickness of the oil film.

Question_Title: If the head pressure of a reciprocating refrigeration compressor is excessive, __________.
Answer_1: the relief valve should open before the high pressure cutout
Answer_2: the relief valve should open and allow the excess refrigerant to flow to the receiver
Answer_3: the high pressure cutout switch should operate before the relief valve opens
Answer_4: you should close in on the suction valve

Question_Title: Pitting in the suction areas of a centrifugal pump bronze impeller is usually caused by __________.
The control mode in which the final control element is moved from one of two fixed positions to the other is known as __________.
Radial thrust developed in high pressure centrifugal pumps  can be eliminated by the use of __________.
The welding process using an electric arc developed between a flux covered electrode and the metal being welded is known as __________.
Devices which utilize the rapid flow of a fluid to entrain  another fluid and thereby move it from one place to another are called __________.
One cause of high head pressure occurring in a refrigeration system can be __________.
Answer_1: insufficient cooling water flow to the condenser
Answer_2: a low refrigerant charge in the system
Answer_3: the liquid valve is open too much

Question_Title: The usual symptoms of cavitation in a centrifugal pump is __________.
A control action which produces a corrective signal relative to the speed at which the controlled variable is changing is known as __________.
The diffusion ring installed in many high pressure  centrifugal pumps, such as feed pumps, __________.
Answer_2: imparts kinetic energy to the water passing through the pump
Answer_3: alleviates the need for a double suction impeller
Answer_4: eliminates radial thrust to the impeller

Question_Title: The substance primarily responsible for heat loss in the combustion process is __________.
Air trapped in the hydraulic fluid of a steering system may be indicated by __________.
Answer_3: a constantly occurring improper rudder response

Question_Title: Setting up a welding job, where the work is the positive pole and the electrode is the negative pole for the arc, is known as a/an __________.
The steam supplied to operate a steam driven reciprocating  pump is usually obtained from the __________.
Answer_1: desuperheated steam line via a reducing station
Answer_3: main steam line via a reducing station

Question_Title: Which of the following statements concerning the operation  of steam pressure reducing valves is correct?
Answer_1: Reducing station relief valves must be lifted by hand at least once a watch.
Answer_2: The cut out valve at the outlet of the reducing valve should be throttled when in operation.
Answer_3: Reducing valves should be warmed-up and drained before they are adjusted.
Answer_4: Reducing valves are absolutely reliable and require no routine maintenance.

Question_Title: Which of the problems listed would cause the discharge temperature of an R-12 refrigeration compressor to increase?
A plug tap is correctly used for __________.
Answer_2: reversing the threads in a hole
Answer_3: the second cut when threading a blind hole
Answer_4: finishing the threads in a blind hole

Question_Title: If it were necessary for you to frequently replace the bearings of the condensate pump, the trouble could be the result of __________.
Answer_3: salt water contamination of the condensate

Question_Title: A control action which produces a corrective signal relative to the length of time the controlled variable has been away from the set point, is known as __________.
When renewing only a portion of an entire hull plate with an insert plate, which of the listed guidelines should be followed?
Answer_1: The insert plate should cover at least one full frame space.
Answer_2: The lines of new welding should, where possible, lie in existing lines of welding.
Answer_3: The corners of the insert plate should be square.
Answer_4: The insert plate should be at least 9/16 thick.

Question_Title: An O-ring seal in a hydraulic system will begin to leak when it has lost its interference fit due to __________.
When welding, a flux is used to __________.
Some heavy duty screwdrivers are made with a square shank to __________.
Answer_1: allow it to be used as a pry bar

Question_Title: When drilling holes in metal, which of the materials listed does not have to be lubricated?
Low compressor head pressure in a refrigeration system can  be caused by __________.
The device used to retain the packing, that keeps water from entering the ship through the opening where the propeller shaft passes through the hull, is called a __________.
If misalignment between a pump and its driving source exceeds that specified by the pump manufacturer, the shaft  __________.
Answer_1: flexible coupling will absorb all such misalignment
Answer_2: total end float travel will be excessive
Answer_3: lateral float will be greatly increased
Answer_4: bearings will be overloaded and will fail

Question_Title: The control mode where the position of the final control element has a linear relationship with the position or value of the controlled variable, is known as __________.
One function of a replenishing pump installed in many pressure-closed hydraulic systems, is to supply fluid flow  to __________.
Answer_4: the main system accumulators under all operating conditions

Question_Title: The duties of a chief engineer upon taking charge of the department include __________.
Answer_1: preparing a list of engine department personnel for the Master's signature
Answer_2: taking a complete personal inventory of all engine room spare parts
Answer_3: determining if any vital engine room equipment is inoperative
Answer_4: obtaining a valid Certification of Inspection from the Coast Guard

Question_Title: Small passenger vessels of less than 100 gross tons shall be drydocked or hauled out at intervals not to exceed 60 months if it operates __________.
Answer_1: 6 months in fresh water and 6 months in salt water
Answer_3: in saltwater a total of 9 months in the 18 months since last drydock period
Answer_4: in saltwater 6 months or less within each 12 months period  since drydocking

Question_Title: A low refrigeration compressor discharge pressure can be caused by __________.
Answer_2: wasted zinc plates in the condenser
Answer_4: faulty door gaskets on the refrigerator

Question_Title: An offset screwdriver is best used for __________.
Answer_2: tightening or loosening 'offset type' machine screws
Answer_4: screws you cannot reach with a straight shaft screwdriver

Question_Title: If the shaft packing for a centrifugal pump requires replacement more frequently than normal, a possible cause may be __________.
The ratio of output response to a specified change in the input is known as __________.
To prevent air pockets from forming in a centrifugal pump suction line installed angled from normal, any gate valve should be installed with the __________.
Answer_2: centerline above the suction pipe centerline
Answer_3: stem pointing upward at right angles to the pipe
Answer_4: stem horizontal or pointing downward below the pipe

Question_Title: The bleeder plug, or docking plug located on a motor vessel double bottom tank is used to __________.
Answer_1: indicate when the tank is pressed up
Answer_2: provide a secondary means of tank sounding
Answer_3: vent air from the tank when bunkering
Answer_4: empty the tank when in drydock

Question_Title: The blade for a power hacksaw should be installed with the  teeth __________.
Answer_1: pointing either toward or away from the motor end of the machine
Answer_2: pointing away from the motor end of the machine
Answer_3: pointing toward the motor if using a 4 or 6 tooth blade and away from the motor if using a 10 or 14 tooth blade
Answer_4: pointing toward the motor end of the machine

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning welding sequences?
Answer_1: First, weld the joints that will tend to contract the most.
Answer_2: First, weld attachments which will restrain points of maximum contraction.
Answer_3: Make a weld across an unwelded plate joint in adjoining members.
Answer_4: Each successive welded part should be restrained to lock in stresses and avoid cracking.

Question_Title: Which of the listed types of steam end piston rod packing should be used in a steam reciprocating pump?
When drilling holes larger than 1/2 inch, drilling a smaller hole first is a good practice.  This is called a pilot hole, and the pilot drill should have a diameter __________.
Answer_1: slightly larger than the web thickness of the larger drill
Answer_2: equal to at least 1/2 the diameter of the larger drill
Answer_3: smaller than the dead center of chisel edge of the larger drill
Answer_4: small enough to ensure the maximum cut by the larger drill

Question_Title: A pressure drop through the refrigerant liquid line may cause __________.
Answer_3: formation of flash gas in the liquid line

Question_Title: Heavy wear in a particular area of the inner circumference  of a packing ring may be caused by __________.
The steady state difference between the control point and the value of the controlled variable, corresponding with the set point, is known as __________.
With regards to the viscosity of lube oil in an operating system under normal load, the highest viscosity should occur __________.
Answer_1: just prior to entering the lube oil cooler
Answer_2: at the lube oil cooler outlet
Answer_3: at the main lube oil pump discharge
Answer_4: at the narrowest point of the hydrodynamic wedge

Question_Title: Which of the factors listed governs the intensity of heat required for any given welding job?
Answer_1: The strength of the bond only.
Answer_2: The strength of the bond and the welding process being used.
Answer_3: The type of metal being joined only.
Answer_4: The type of metal being joined and the welding process being used.

Question_Title: Which of the listed pumps is NOT a positive displacement pump?
If the thermal bulb of an expansion valve is incorrectly placed at the center of the coil instead of the end, it will __________.
Answer_1: increase the capacity of the coil
Answer_2: increase the superheat at the bulb
Answer_3: deliver more refrigerant to the coil
Answer_4: decrease the capacity of the coil

Question_Title: A grinding wheel is trued with a __________.

Answer_1: fresh water at or above the ambient temperature
Answer_2: circulated cold fresh water, while maintaining all normal unit operating pressures
Answer_3: air and a soap solution to test all joints
Answer_4: phosphorescent hydrazine bisodium solution visible under a  black light source

Question_Title: The quantity or condition which is measured and controlled is known as the __________.

While operating a two-stage flash-type evaporator, designed to operate in sea water of 70°F, the current seawater temperature is 50°F, while the salt water feed temperature  is maintained at 170°F.  The three-way solenoid valve trips, directing the distillate pump discharge to the bilge.  Which of the following conditions is the probable cause for this  occurrence?
Answer_1: Excessive and violent flashing in each stage.
Answer_2: Insufficient vacuum developed as a result of the sea temperature.
Answer_3: Excessive amount of feedwater being supplied to the first stage.
Answer_4: Insufficient brine density being maintained in the second stage.

Question_Title: What is the purpose of heat treating steel?
The major source of chemical contaminants in hydraulic fluid is __________.
Traps in plumbing drains are designed to help prevent __________.
Answer_1: drain noises in the living quarters
Answer_3: air pockets in the sewer lines
Answer_4: escape of odors into the living quarters

Question_Title: The amount of fluid friction or internal friction inherent  in a mineral lubricating oil is reflected as a measure of its __________.

Answer_3: break loose scale deposits formed on the tubes
Answer_4: test for leaks in the tubes

Question_Title: If the speed of a drill is too great, the drill will __________.

Insulation on deck steam piping must be installed securely  as __________.
Answer_1: loose insulation contributes to steam leaks
Answer_2: deck steam lines are subject to vibration
Answer_3: steam driven machinery cannot run with loose insulation
Answer_4: loose insulation prevents normal pipe expansion

Question_Title: The value of the controlled variable, which under any fixed set of conditions the automatic controller operates to maintain, is known as __________.
Air compressor receivers should be 'blown down' at least __________.
A vessel's immediate protection in the event of a broken stern tube is a/an __________.
Hydraulic machinery failures are commonly caused by misalignment of the system components and by __________.
Which of the problems listed could happen if you attempted  to force open a valve 'frozen' in position by using a wrench on the handwheel?
Answer_3: Rapid corrosion of the valve disc
Answer_4: Cracking of gaskets upstream of the valve

Question_Title: A double suction centrifugal pump impeller has been installed in the reverse direction, and will __________.
Answer_3: discharge through the suction side of the pump casing
Answer_4: require more power to turn the shaft

Question_Title: If a centrifugal pump were continually operated with the discharge valve closed, the __________.
Answer_3: relief valve would continuously cycle open

Question_Title: When you adjust a thermostatic expansion valve __________.
Answer_1: refrigerant must be bled off the sensing line before adjustments are made
Answer_2: all refrigerant must be pumped into the receiver before adjustments are made
Answer_3: time must be allowed for conditions to stabilize in the evaporator before further adjustments are made
Answer_4: all refrigerant must be routed through the dehydrator while changing the superheat setting

Question_Title: If water were a semisolid, the linear distance a propeller  would advance in one revolution is the __________.

Answer_1: 10-25% of the original void space in the bearing
Answer_2: 25-50% of the original void space in the bearing
Answer_3: 50-75% of the original void space in the bearing
Answer_4: 75-95% of the original void space in the bearing

Question_Title: When the pressure applied to a Bourdon tube-type pressure gage is reduced to atmospheric pressure, the tube will begin to 'bend' towards the center of arc.  Small variations develop preventing the tube from returning to its exact original shape due to the process known as __________.

The shaft sleeves have recently been replaced on a  centrifugal salt water service pump.  The packing gland is  now drawn tightly up against the casing.  Despite the use of standard procedures to tighten the packing gland, water continues to pour out along the shaft.  The probable cause  for this situation is that __________.
Answer_1: the shaft sleeve "O" ring seals were not installed
Answer_2: suction head pressure has become excessive
Answer_3: the sealing water flow to the stuffing box is blocked
Answer_4: only two sections of the lantern ring were installed

Question_Title: Hydraulic machinery failures are commonly caused by contamination of the hydraulic fluid and __________.
A weld with triangular cross sections is used to join two surfaces at right angles to each other, and is called a __________.
Before drilling a hole in a piece of metal, the location of the hole center should be __________.
The refrigeration system low pressure cutout switch is actuated by __________.
Answer_2: a sensing bulb at the tail coil of the evaporator
Answer_3: pressure changes in the suction line
Answer_4: failure of the king solenoid valve

Question_Title: The movement of steam piping, as a result of changes in temperature, is compensated for by the use of __________.
Traps at plumbing drain connections prevent __________.
Devices, such as a pressure gage, that are subject to continuous expansion and contraction are affected by hysteresis.  This is a natural process that __________.
Answer_1: allows a material to return to its exact original shape
Answer_2: permits a resilient material to return to its almost original shape
Answer_3: allows a resiliant material to resist permanent deformation
Answer_4: is directly related to a material's elastic limit

Question_Title: In an automated control system, which of the following statements would apply to any type of closed loop system?
Answer_1: The manipulated variables are adjusted only from the input demand signals without monitoring the outlet  conditions or variables.
Answer_2: Another term commonly used in conjunction with this type of system is 'feed forward.'
Answer_3: The controlled variable must always deviate from its set point before any corrective action is initiated by the controller.
Answer_4: In order for a system to fall under the category of closed loop control, there should be no adjustments required to be made manually by the operator.

Question_Title: A knocking sound emitted from an unloaded air compressor is probably caused by __________.
Which of the following statements is true concerning any evaporator?
Answer_1: High conductivity of the distillate indicates distillate salinity is excessive.
Answer_2: Increasing the absolute pressure of the shell will increase the distiller's capacity.
Answer_3: Mesh separators are used in evaporators to filter the distillate.
Answer_4: Reducing the brine density will reduce the heat lost overboard.

Question_Title: If a centrifugal pump operating with a positive suction head vibrates, or becomes noisy, the cause could be __________.
A piece missing from one blade of a four-bladed propeller  could result in __________.
The sensing line for the low pressure cutout switch to a refrigeration system is located __________.
Answer_3: on the suction side of the compressor
Answer_4: on the discharge side of the compressor

Question_Title: A taper tap is correctly used for __________.
Answer_2: producing tapered threads in a hole
Answer_3: deepening the extent of existing threads in a hole
Answer_4: finishing the threading operation in a blind hole

Question_Title: Which type of screwdriver listed would have a 'Keystone' type vertical cross-sectional tip?
When the ship's bulkheads are reinforced against bending and bulging, the bulkheads are provided with __________.
In the production of freshwater from seawater through a process of heating and cooling, the cooling phase of production is usually called __________.
Which of the listed metals can usually be drilled without lubrication?
If a centrifugal pump sealing line becomes restricted while operating under a negative suction head (suction lift), the inner end of the stuffing box will be __________.
Answer_1: under a vacuum and air will tend to leak into the pump
Answer_2: sealed by the fluid being pumped and no leakage will occur
Answer_3: under pressure and fluid will tend to leak into the pump
Answer_4: sealed by the seal cage or pump lantern ring

Question_Title: All straight shanked twist drills must be mounted or held in a __________.
The low pressure cutout switch used on a refrigeration system compressor is set to cut in at approximately 5 psig  and cutout at __________.
Excessive propeller vibration may occur as a result of __________.
Answer_2: high water pressure under the hull

Question_Title: Small passenger vessel of less than 100 gross tons shall be drydocked or hauled out at intervals not to exceed 36 months if it is operated in saltwater a total of___________.
Answer_1: more than 9 months in the last 18 month period
Answer_2: less than 9 months in each of the last 12 months
Answer_3: 30 months in the last 36 months since drydocking or haul out
Answer_4: 6 months or less in each 12 month period since it was last  drydocked or hauled out

Question_Title: Information from a data-logger can be helpful in determining the long term probability of machinery failure if you __________.
Answer_1: evaluate only the latest logged data as this is the best indication of plant status
Answer_2: evaluate a series of readings to obtain operating trends
Answer_3: monitor off limit conditions only when announced by an audible and visual signal
Answer_4: secure the machine under relatively steady state conditions

Question_Title: The process of boiling seawater in order to separate it into freshwater vapor and brine is usually defined as __________.
If the cutting edges of a drill are ground at different angles, the __________.
The purpose of the low pressure cutout switch is to __________.
Answer_1: maintain liquid refrigerant at the suction of the compressor
Answer_2: maintain a preset suction pressure to the compressor
Answer_3: start and stop the compressor at preset operating pressures

Question_Title: Partially clogged or scored nozzles in a two stage air ejector unit of a flash distilling plant could result in a  __________.
Answer_1: fluctuating vacuum in the flash chamber
Answer_3: high water level in the air ejector after condenser
Answer_4: malfunctioning check valve in the air ejector discharge

Question_Title: In modern ship construction, high tensile steel (HTS) may be permitted in __________.

Answer_1: prevent chemical breakdown of hydraulic fluid
Answer_2: remove condensation from the fluid reservoir
Answer_3: prevent the anchor from seizing in the hawsepipe
Answer_4: renew the internal coating of lubrication

Question_Title: If two centrifugal pumps, driven by two independent electric motors, operating at unequal speeds are discharging an inflammable liquid through a common discharge line, the higher speed pump may cause the slower pump to __________.
The dimension of the thinnest hydrodynamic film developed within a full journal bearing, when all other factors remain constant, depends upon the __________.
The purpose of the refrigeration system low pressure cutout switch is to __________.
Answer_1: protect the compressor from liquid flood back
Answer_2: protect the compressor from low discharge pressure
Answer_3: start and stop the compressor upon system demand
Answer_4: start the compressor after a drop in the evaporator pressure

Question_Title: Mechanical shaft seals used on water service pumps require  lubrication of the seal faces to minimize deposits of foreign matter on those surfaces.  Which of the following pressures and lubricants are required?
Which of the following conditions can develop if a valve with a badly scored valve stem is repacked?
Answer_2: Leaking and premature failure of the packing.
Answer_3: The valve disk will become eroded.
Answer_4: The valve seat will sustain damage due to fretting.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements best describes a  'Keystone' shaped tip on a standard screwdriver?
Answer_1: A straight shank that does not widen at the top of the blade.
Answer_2: A fourway tip cut at right angles.
Answer_3: A blade whose width is approximately that of the shank diameter with flattened tapered sides.

Question_Title: Overheating of a hydraulic system may be a result of __________.
Answer_1: changing pump discharge pressure in response to normal load variations
Answer_4: continued slow recirculation of the oil

Question_Title: Condensate must be drained periodically from the air compressor receivers to prevent __________.

Rapid wear on the extreme outer corners to the cutting edges of a drill bit is the result of the drill having __________.

Answer_1: compressor discharge valve and the condenser

Question_Title: Which of the following types of nuts would be best suited to use when it is important that a nut not work itself loose due to vibration?
In pressure measurement, absolute pressure is defined as the difference in pressure between __________.
Answer_1: any two pressures measured with respect to a common reference
Answer_2: atmospheric pressure and barometric pressure at a given point
Answer_3: gage pressure and ambient atmospheric pressure
Answer_4: a perfect vacuum and the total pressure at a given point

Question_Title: The nameplate of a reciprocating pump lists the following dimensions: "7 X 6 X 4".  The diameter of the liquid cylinder is __________.

Answer_1: the amount of mineral and metallic solids that will not burn
Answer_2: the number of milligrams of potassium hydroxide used to neutralize a measured sample
Answer_3: what type of acid contaminants are present in a measured sample
Answer_4: how much sulfuric acid the oil has absorbed during  operations

Question_Title: An oil separator is a device used to remove oil from the __________.

Answer_1: The neutralization number has decreased below minimum levels.
Answer_2: The sole use of the increase in the neutralization number need only be the basis for this decision.
Answer_3: In addition to the increase in the neutralization number, the viscosity of oil has also increased.
Answer_4: A small rise in the neutralization number over several years of use has prompted this decision.

Question_Title: In an automation system, the effect of a control action sensed by a controller is known as __________.
Purging air from a hydraulic system is necessary when __________.
Answer_1: adding small amounts of oil to the system
Answer_3: the system has been drained and then filled with new oil
Answer_4: the system has been idle for a long period of time

Question_Title: Which of the following components would be necessary for the proper operation of a potable hot water system?
Which of the following statements concerning deep well cargo pumps is correct?
Answer_2: The impeller is located at the upper end of the shaft.
Answer_4: The prime mover is connected at the lower portion of the shaft.

Question_Title: Joiner bulkheads on a MODU provide __________.

Answer_1: The overall condition of the bearing surface should be examined.
Answer_2: The shaft liner should be inspected for cracks and tested to insure a tight fit.
Answer_3: The stern tube should be tested for cracks with dye penetrant.

Question_Title: When adding packing to a seal involving motion, you must be careful to prevent __________.
Answer_3: deterioration of the packing due to excessive tightening

Question_Title: Oil separators installed in refrigeration systems serve to  __________.
Answer_1: remove excess oil from the system
Answer_2: remove oil entrained in high pressure liquid lines
Answer_3: return oil entrained in refrigerant vapor back to the compressor crankcase

Question_Title: The brine density in a submerged tube evaporator should be  maintained at __________.
Answer_1: 1.0 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Answer_2: 1.5 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Answer_3: 2.0 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water
Answer_4: 3.5 pounds of salt per 32 pounds of water

Question_Title: A screwdriver should never be used as a __________.
Which of the following conditions will prevent a shipboard  pump from achieving its maximum suction lift?
Answer_1: Leaks developed in the suction piping.
Answer_2: Friction losses as a result of improperly sized pipe.
Answer_3: Gases or vapors released in the liquid as a result of greater than normal pressure drops.

Question_Title: Structural bulkheads on a MODU are usually __________.
Plug valves installed in hydraulic systems are most suitable for use as __________.
In a disk-type lubricating oil purifier, __________.
Answer_1: the purifier driving gears are lubricated by the reclaimed  oil as it leaves the bowl
Answer_2: all dirt and sludge are automatically discharged with the cooling water
Answer_3: sealing water must never be supplied until after oil is fed to the unit
Answer_4: deterioration of the bowl ring gasket will cause the purifier to lose its water seal

Question_Title: Properties of a good refrigeration oil include __________.
Pushing the file endways (or with the axis), under pressure, against the work, is called __________.
Medium temperature hot water systems have been used in place of small auxiliary boilers producing 100 psig steam with __________.
The lignum vitae in a stern tube bearing is normally lubricated with __________.
Which of the following guidelines is considered to reflect  good design practices for shipboard steam heating systems?
Answer_1: Provide orifice-type bypasses for all traps and automatic valves.
Answer_2: Provide a dirt pocket and strainer ahead of the steam trap  on a unit heater return.
Answer_3: Provide all units with a dirt trap and gate valve in the supply and a check valve on the return.
Answer_4: Wherever possible install vertical runs for condensate piping.

Question_Title: To anneal a copper gasket, you should heat the gasket __________.
Answer_2: and let cool slowly in the air
Answer_3: cherry red and quench in water

Question_Title: Reinforcing frames attached to a bulkhead on a MODU are called __________.
Hydraulically, servo-operated, automatic, change over valves, utilized in a two ram hydraulic steering gear, serve to __________.
Answer_1: allow an alternate main pump to start in the fully loaded condition thus developing immediate full torque
Answer_2: prevent either main pump from being hydraulically motored when idle by cross pressure flow
Answer_3: prevent both units from operating simultaneously which could result in doubling the flow of oil and pressure leading to  over pressurization of the system

Question_Title: Ball peen hammers are sized according to their __________.
If a stateroom has a 6" by 12" opening through which air travels at 100 feet per minute, what is the volume of air being supplied to the stateroom?
Liquid is kept from leaking out at the shaft ends of a helical gear pump by __________.
Answer_4: the use of shaft end caps

Question_Title: The stern tube flushing connection can be used to _________,
Answer_1: assist in flushing out all packing strips when renewing packing underway
Answer_2: provide a positive flow of water through the stern tube for lubricating, cooling, and flushing when required
Answer_3: flush out brackish water resulting from extended in port operation
Answer_4: serve as the only source of supply of water for the stern tube bearing

Question_Title: A Bourdon tube-type steam pressure gage is fitted with a siphon loop to prevent damage from the direct effects of __________.

Answer_2: viscosity of the oil being purified
Answer_3: maximum design speed of that purifier
Answer_4: specific gravity of the oil being purified

Question_Title: A vessel is in compliance with federal regulations regarding the discharge of sewage by __________.
Answer_2: treating sewage in an approved system
Answer_3: pumping the sewage ashore to an approved container

Question_Title: In MODU construction, beams are transverse girders which provide support to __________.
If a stateroom has a 5 inch by 12 inch opening through which the air travels at 100 feet per minute, what is the volume  of air being supplied to the stateroom?
Which of the following statements is true regarding mechanical seals?
Answer_1: They may be used in lieu of conventional packing glands for any service other than saltwater.
Answer_2: They are not suitable for use on fuel oil transfer pumps.
Answer_3: They are normally lubricated and cooled by the fluid being  pumped.
Answer_4: Once placed into service, leakage between the dynamic seal  surfaces may be reduced by monthly adjustment of the spring compression.

Question_Title: The number "8" in the notation of an '8-32' tap, indicates  the __________.

Answer_2: distance between the face and the edge of the file
Answer_3: distance between the point and the heel of the file

Question_Title: Which of the following is the most common type of valving element used in hydraulic system directional control valves?

Answer_1: 1/4 inch in diameter with a pitch of 20 threads per inch
Answer_2: 1/2 inch long having a total of 20 threads
Answer_3: a total of 20 threads with a pitch of 1/4 inch
Answer_4: 1/20 of an inch long and 1/4 inch in diameter

Question_Title: A one ton air conditioning system has which of the listed operating characteristics?
Answer_1: It forces 2,000 lbs. of refrigerant through the evaporator per day.
Answer_2: It forces 2,000 lbs. of air per hour across the evaporator coils.
Answer_3: Its cooling power equals that of melting 2,000 lbs. of ice per day.

Question_Title: Which of the materials listed is used as the dynamic seal material on mechanical seals installed on most centrifugal  pumps used in water service?

Answer_1: Contamination of the lube oil by emulsification will result.
Answer_2: The lube oil will not be subjected to the proper centrifugal force.
Answer_3: The lube oil will overheat and flash.
Answer_4: Oil will discharge from the heavy phase discharge port and  be wasted.

Question_Title: Feedwater supplied to a flash type distilling plant will flash to vapor in the first-stage due to __________.
Answer_1: flash chamber pressure pressure being lower than the saturation pressure corresponding to the feedwater temperature
Answer_2: temperature being higher than the evaporation temperature of the supplied feedwater
Answer_3: heat exchange surfaces being directly in the path of the entering feedwater
Answer_4: orifices finely atomizing the heated feedwater entering the flash chamber

Question_Title: Stanchions prevent the entire deck load on a MODU from being carried by the __________.
The Phillips screwdriver has a blunt end and flukes with an angle of __________.
When using a handheld hacksaw, you should apply pressure only on the forward stroke __________.
Answer_1: only when cutting thin wall tubing

Question_Title: An important consideration in selecting a lubricating oil for use in a refrigeration compressor is for the oil to __________.
If the intercooler relief valve lifts while an air  compressor is operating under load, you should check for __________.
Answer_1: a defective pressure switch or pilot valve
Answer_2: a leak in the intercooler piping
Answer_3: leakage through the low pressure unloader control diaphragm

Question_Title: Which of the following statements represents the main difference between a stuffing box gland and a mechanical seal for sealing the shaft of a centrifugal pump?
Answer_1: Packed stuffing box glands are subject to wear, but mechanical seals are not.
Answer_2: Packed stuffing box glands must be cooled by the liquid being pumped, but mechanical seals do not require cooling.
Answer_3: If packing fails, the pump can be kept running temporarily  by tightening the gland, but if a mechanical seal fails it  must be totally renewed to stop the leakage.
Answer_4: The sealing surface of a mechanical seal is parallel to the shaft, but the sealing surface of a packed gland is perpendicular to the shaft.

Question_Title: In a shell-and-tube type hydraulic fluid cooler, the amount of heat transferred from the hydraulic fluid to the cooling water depends upon __________.
Answer_1: the temperature of the hydraulic fluid
Answer_2: the flow rate of both the cooling water and the hydraulic fluid
Answer_3: the temperature of the cooling water

Question_Title: Support of MODU side plating is provided primarily by transverse __________.

Answer_1: angle formed by adjacent flanks of a thread
Answer_2: number of threads divided by the length of the threaded portion of the screw
Answer_3: distance between corresponding points on adjacent threads
Answer_4: angle of taper formed by the centerline of the screw and the crests of the thread

Question_Title: The presence of scale and dirt on the saltwater side of a lube oil cooler is usually indicated by __________.
Answer_2: seawater leaking into the lube oil system

Question_Title: One refrigeration ton is equal to __________.

The tool used to remove a ball bearing from the shaft of a  motor is called a __________.
Fabric type packing, such as flax or hemp, is best suited for __________.
Answer_4: packing valves with badly grooved stems

Question_Title: Which of the listed problems is occurring if a coil type high pressure evaporator constantly requires an increase in the coil steam pressure in order to maintain capacity?
Answer_2: Heat transfer surfaces are being layered with scale.
Answer_4: Shell vapor pressure is constantly decreasing.

Question_Title: Lighter longitudinal stiffening frames on the MODU side plating are called __________.

Answer_2: takes the pump off stroke when the desired rudder angle is  attained.
Answer_3: allows for rudder movement faster than the movement of the  ship's wheel.
Answer_4: returns the rudder to amidships when the wheel is released.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is true concerning a radiator type heat exchanger?
Answer_1: Raw water is the cooling medium.
Answer_2: Water cooled exhaust elbows remove the heat.
Answer_3: The surge tank must be located a minimum of 4 feet above the highest finned tube.

Question_Title: How much heat can a 5 ton refrigeration unit remove from a  refrigerated space?

Answer_2: loosened until the gland clears the stuffing box
Answer_3: tightened an additional 10% to compress the packing
