Question_Title: Aftercoolers are used with air compressors to __________.
Answer_1: reduce the temperature of compressed air
Answer_2: decrease the density of compressed air
Answer_3: dampen pressure pulses in the discharge air
Answer_4: ensure complete expansion of the compressed air

Question_Title: In the last effect of a multi-effect submerged tube distilling plant rapid fluctuations of the absolute pressure tend to cause __________.
Answer_1: scale formation with increased heat transfer
Answer_2: priming with increased salinity of distillate
Answer_3: slight foaming at the distillate feed pump
Answer_4: improved operating conditions at the brine pump

Question_Title: The heavier outboard strake of deck plating on a MODU is called the deck __________.
In which of the following types of evaporators is the control of brine density least important?

Answer_1: metallic packing on the inlet end

Question_Title: What is the equivalent tonnage of a refrigeration system rated at 48,000 BTU per hour?
Leaking valves in a low pressure, reciprocating, air compressor can result from __________.
Answer_2: operating the compressor at excessive speed
Answer_3: uneven piston stroke in the compressor

Question_Title: Rudder motion is prevented from exceeding the movement of the steering wheel by the __________.

Answer_1: inject water vapor into the compressed air
Answer_2: prevent overheating of first stage valves
Answer_4: reduce the compressed air charge density

Question_Title: Return lines in a non-pressurized hydraulic system  reservoir should enter the tank well below the fluid surface level to __________.

Answer_4: a brine overflow weir set too low

Question_Title: Where is thicker plating usually found in the construction  of integral tanks on a MODU?
Answer_1: On the outside of the tank.
Answer_2: At the bottom of the tank.
Answer_3: At the top of the tank.
Answer_4: At the center of the tank.

Question_Title: When renewing the shaft packing on a centrifugal pump equipped with an external liquid sealing supply, you should __________.
Answer_1: always turn down the shaft in a lathe to ensure a snug fit
Answer_2: ensure that the lantern ring is aligned with the sealing supply opening

Answer_4: make sure the seal cage is always positioned at the base of the stuffing box

Question_Title: If an air conditioning system were rated at 24,000 BTU, the equivalent tonnage of the unit would be __________.

Answer_1: compressor would stop abruptly when power was secured
Answer_3: air receiver indicated pressure would be excessively low
Answer_4: compressor would require more than the normal amount of lubrication

Question_Title: On an electro-hydraulic steering gear, which of the listed  devices will keep the rudder from overtraveling the bridge  signal?

Answer_2: tubes of the saltwater feed heater are flooded internally

Question_Title: The Reed and Prince screwdriver has a sharp pointed end with flukes that have an angle of __________.

Answer_1: Close the pressure gage isolation valves.

Answer_3: Secure the stuffing box sealing water line.
Answer_4: Trip the three way dump valve.

Question_Title: On tankers with manually operated tank valves, the type of  valve most commonly used is the __________.

Answer_1: eliminate scaling problems on the saltwater side

Answer_3: protect the piping assembly from external rudder shock

Question_Title: Steam supply piping to deck machinery is insulated in order to __________.

Answer_3: reduce heat loss from the system

Question_Title: A piece of tapered round stock 36 inches long, 4 inches in  diameter at the large end and 2 1/2 inches in diameter at the small end.  What tailstock setover was used to machine  the taper?
When a heat exchanger is used as a cooler, excessive cooling water flow should be avoided to prevent __________.

Answer_1: dynamically balance the shaft and impeller
Answer_2: check the shaft and impeller assembly on centers to see if  the ring surfaces are true
Answer_3: visually inspect the rings after about an hour of service

Question_Title: If a refrigeration system extracted 48,000 BTU per hour, the equivalent tonnage of the unit would be __________.
If a ship service air compressor failed to unload the __________.
Answer_2: air receiver pressure would be excessively low

Question_Title: In an electro-hydraulic steering system, rudder shock is limited by __________.
Which of the following statements is true regarding a positive displacement rotary pump?
Answer_1: Theoretically, there is no limit to shut off head pressure.
Answer_3: The discharge side should be protected against excessive pressure build up via a relief valve.

Question_Title: Rapid fluctuation of the last effect shell vacuum in a submerged tube evaporator can cause __________.
Answer_2: air leaks in the tube nest

Answer_1: compensate for major leaks in the system
Answer_3: allow for changes in pressure and temperature within the system

Question_Title: An air conditioning system, required to remove from 33,000  to 35,000 BTU per hour, should have a minimum capacity of __________.

Answer_2: air receiver pressure would be excessively low
Answer_3: circuit breaker may open on starting

Question_Title: If a centrifugal pump develops insufficient discharge pressure as a result of worn wearing rings, which of the following corrective actions is required?
Answer_2: Throttle in on the discharge valve.
Answer_3: Always replace the wearing rings and the impeller as a set.
Answer_4: Throttle in on the suction valve.

Question_Title: Accidental flooding of the engine room bilges through the bilge system is prevented by __________.
Answer_1: stop-check valves installed in the bilge suction manifolds
Answer_2: using a positive displacement reciprocating bilge pump
Answer_3: installing eductors in all bilge rose boxes
Answer_4: installing a swing check before each bilge valve

Question_Title: When the compressed air reservoir is placed in line with an air compressor and is used as an aftercooler, the reservoir must be __________.
Answer_3: fitted with a moisture trap at the inlet

Question_Title: Priming in a submerged tube evaporator can be caused by high water level and __________.

Answer_1: allow free movement of hydraulic fluid in both directions
Answer_2: allow fluid flow in one direction only
Answer_3: allow throttled fluid flow in one direction only
Answer_4: restrict hydraulic fluid flow in both directions

Question_Title: The receiver used in a refrigeration system __________.

Answer_1: not be made without the knowledge and approval of the OCMI
Answer_2: be permissable without the knowledge and approval of the Officer in Charge of Marine Inspection
Answer_3: be made at anytime convenient to the vessel operator without prior approval
Answer_4: be made only when Coast Guard Administrative Form 2892 is submitted

Question_Title: In a double-effect submerged tube evaporator, the brine density should be prevented from falling below 1.5/32nds to minimize __________.
Answer_1: scale formation on the tube nests

Question_Title: If there is a sudden drop in the capacity of a reciprocating air compressor, you should check for __________.
Answer_2: worn piston rings or cylinder liners
Answer_4: a defective pressure switch or pilot valve

Question_Title: Which of the equipment listed is most effective in  processing bilge slops for overboard discharge?
Answer_2: Assembling the lube oil purifier as a separator and aligning it to the bilge overboard.

Question_Title: When a reciprocating pump is operating at maximum speed, the cushioning valves should be __________.

Answer_1: prevent oil backflow to the actuators
Answer_2: prevent the hydraulic pump from overheating
Answer_3: control the speed of the hatch cover movement while closing
Answer_4: restrict the oil supply to the hatch covers not in use

Question_Title: During the inspection for certification of small passenger  vessel of less than 100 gross tons, a hydrostatic test of 1-1/4 times the maximum allowable working pressure shall be made to __________.

Improper waterside venting of the tube nests in a submerged tube evaporator will cause a/an __________.
Answer_3: increased vacuum in the first effect

Question_Title: The static suction head of a horizontal centrifugal pump, is the difference in elevation between the __________.
Answer_1: discharge liquid level and the suction liquid level
Answer_2: discharge liquid level and the pump centerline
Answer_3: suction liquid level and the pump centerline
Answer_4: suction submergence level and the pump discharge

Question_Title: A drilled hole is accurately finished to size with a __________.

Answer_1: illuminated at all times while vessel is underway
Answer_2: illuminated automatically and actuated upon failure of the  main lighting system
Answer_3: portable battery operated and have sufficient capacity for 8 hours of continuous operations

Question_Title: When air compressors are arranged for automatic operation,  the cylinders can be unloaded during starting and stopping  by __________.
Answer_2: fitting depressors which hold the suction valve plates on their seats
Answer_3: step unloading the cylinders in a multi-cylinder machine

Question_Title: If a higher than normal water level is observed through the inspection port of a flash evaporator, you should suspect __________.
Answer_1: a leak in the feedwater heater

Question_Title: A Reed and Prince screwdriver should be used only on a Reed and Prince screw, and a Phillips screwdriver should only be used on a Phillips screws in order to avoid damaging the __________. * I.tool * II. Screwhead
Reciprocating air compressor bearing failure may result from __________.

Answer_1: regulating the ratio between torque and speed via the torque limiter at the motor
Answer_2: directing the motor output flow through a bypass line
Answer_3: maintaining a constant flow and pressure input

Question_Title: When checking zinc plates, or pencils in the refrigerating  system condenser, you should __________.
Answer_1: paint and insulate the plates to prevent corrosion
Answer_2: renew the plates at each inspection
Answer_3: replace the zincs if deteriorated by 50%
Answer_4: file the plates to change the negative value

Question_Title: For drilling or machining cast iron, which of the cutting lubricants is it necessary to use?

Answer_1: volute in the centrifugal type pump
Answer_2: volute in the propeller type pump
Answer_3: velocity nozzle in the centrifugal type pump
Answer_4: reciprocating piston in the centrifugal type pump

Question_Title: In a flash evaporator, scale as a result of higher than normal temperatures is most likely to occur in the __________.

No two drills from differing drill sets are of the exact same size, with the exception of the drills measured as 0.25 inch.  These two drills are the 1/4 inch and the __________.

Answer_1: increased capacity to set flooding boundaries

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the advantage of the mechanical shaft sealing system over the stuffing box and packing method of shaft sealing for propulsion shafting?
Answer_1: It eliminates the repairing or renewing of the shaft sleeve.
Answer_2: It is fully automatic in operation.
Answer_3: It allows for the removal and reinstallation of all parts without dismantling the shafts.
Answer_4: Each of the above is correct.

Question_Title: Zinc rods are installed in the refrigeration system __________.

Answer_3: at least one watertight bulkhead to prevent fire advancement for 2 hours
Answer_4: a minumum of four watertight bulkheads

Question_Title: A squealing sound generated by an operating reciprocating air compressor would indicate __________.

Answer_1: maintaining the proper distilling plant heat balance

Question_Title: Allowances may be made for the expansion and contraction in piping by the use of expansion joints or __________.

Answer_1: increase the power required for compression
Answer_2: decrease the power required for compression
Answer_3: allow isothermal compression of the air charge
Answer_4: allow the compressed air volume to remain constant

Question_Title: The zinc plates are located in the __________.

Answer_4: a 10 inch (254 mm) dome installed just below the suction inlet and provided with a pipe-opening within one inch of the dome

Answer_2: moving the automatic pressure differential valve
Answer_3: moving the receiving telemotor which regulates the two-way  valve
Answer_4: varying the eccentricity of a floating ring or angle of a tilting box

Question_Title: Penetrations and openings in watertight bulkheads in a vessel of less than 100 gross tons must __________.

Answer_1: carbon deposits on valves and pistons

Question_Title: Which of the flange types listed identifies the construction of a pipe joint where a flange is slipped over a length of  pipe, the pipe end is heated, then setup (flanged) in a special machine, and then the end of the pipe is machined to form the actual face of the joint?

Answer_3: Alignment is not a critical factor in their installation.

Question_Title: A water regulating valve controls the refrigeration condenser cooling water flow in response to condenser __________.
Which of the screwdrivers listed has a tip surrounded by parallel fluted ridges resembling the ridges of a splined socket wrench?

Answer_1: performing a check run on the unit at regular intervals
Answer_2: testing the hydraulic fluid for proper pH
Answer_3: checking the reservoir for proper level

Question_Title: If the flow rate to a linear actuator is reduced by half of the original amount, the __________.

Answer_3: speed of the actuator will be increased

Question_Title: Irregular feeding or surging of the feedwater supply to a flash evaporator may be attributed to  __________.

Answer_2: a clogged vent line from the air eductor condenser
Answer_3: excessive pressure in the seawater feed heater
Answer_4: a dirty strainer in the saltwater feed pump suction line

Question_Title: Operating a reciprocating air compressor without an air intake filter can result in a/an __________.

Question_Title: Machinery with ball bearings designed to be filled with grease should have the relief plug temporarily removed while grease is being added.  This plug should remain out until the machinery has been operated and sufficiently warmed up  to ensure that __________.
Answer_1: a path of expansion is provided for the grease
Answer_2: all air pockets are vented from the grease
Answer_3: dirt and grit are flushed from the bearing housing
Answer_4: the grease is properly distributed within the bearing

Question_Title: The nameplate of a reciprocating pump lists the following numerals as indicated 7" X 6" X 4".  The diameter of the steam cylinder is __________.

Answer_3: Variable speed screwdriver with a jacobs chuck
Answer_4: Constant rpm screwdriver with a jacobs chuck

Question_Title: An arrow stamped on the valve body of a water regulating valve indicates the __________.
Which of the following frequent maintenance procedures is required of compressed air receivers?
Answer_1: A close watch on the temperature.
Answer_2: Constant cleaning to remove oil and dirt.
Answer_3: Constant testing of the relief valves.

Question_Title: The main difference between a common lathe dog and a safety lathe dog is that the latter __________.

Answer_1: using an acceptable metallic fitting, welded or otherwise is attached to the bulkhead or deck by an acceptable method
Answer_2: the rigid nonmetallic plastic pipe is at least of schedule  160 and a metallic shut off valve is provided adjacent to the through deck or bulkhead fitting
Answer_3: metallic shut off valves are welded to nonmetallic hull materials
Answer_4: two non-remotely operated metallic valves are installed on  either side of the deck or bulkhead regardless of accessability

Question_Title: The brake horsepower of a centrifugal pump will vary directly as the __________.
Answer_2: square of the diameter of the impeller
Answer_3: cube of the diameter of the impeller

Answer_3: The amount of heat required to change the temperature of one pound of butter, one degree F.

Question_Title: To add refrigerant to the low side of an air conditioning system, the refrigerant should be introduced through the __________.

Answer_3: the maximum allowable working pressure of the system

Question_Title: Which of the following statements describes the accepted method for testing a thermostatic expansion valve?

Question_Title: A fine wire bristled brush used for cleaning files is called a __________.

Answer_4: at the mid-horizontal level of a vertically run tail coil

Question_Title: The type of tooth set on a hacksaw blade where every third tooth remains straight, while the other two are alternately set is known as __________.

Answer_3: stored in an upright position in addition to being secured  so as to prevent accidental release of the refrigerant within a confined space
Answer_4: protected by a relief valve set to relieve at a pressure not exceeding the maximum allowable working pressure of the vessel

Question_Title: In an air conditioning system, low head pressure associated with a reciprocating compressor can be the result of __________.

Answer_1: Clean outlet pipe and secure bulb tangential to the flow of refrigerant.
Answer_2: Clean off oxidation from the surface of the suction line and sensing bulb with fine abrasive cloth.

Answer_4: Heat shrink insulating material around the device once the  bulb has been properly secured.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning requirements for propellers?

Answer_2: When steel propellers are used, zinc anodes are to be fitted on the aftermost strut bearing housing and on the forward most section of the rudder assembly.
Answer_3: The exposed steel of the shaft is to be protected from the  action of the water by filling all spaces between the cap,  hub and shaft with a suitable material.
Answer_4: Ultrasonic examinations of the propeller may be performed in lieu of required drydocking periods, provided certified copies are distributed to the proper regulatory bodies.

Question_Title: Which of the following statements is correct concerning the regulations (46 CFR) regarding internal combustion engine exhausts, boiler and galley uptakes, and similar sources of ignition?
Answer_1: They shall be kept clear of and suitably insulated from any woodwork or other combustible matter.
Answer_2: All exhausts and uptakes shall run as close as possible to  the horizontal and shall exit the machinery space at a point above the highest load line.
Answer_3: The general construction of the vessel shall be such as to  minimize noise hazards in the upper machinery spaces.
Answer_4: This protection shall be such as to be capable of preventing an excessive temperature rise in the upper machinery spaces.

Question_Title: The latent heat of water vapor in air is dependent upon the __________.

Answer_2: apply a light film of oil to prevent oxidation

Specific heat of the cargo equals 0.39 BTU/LB/°F, with a container heat gain of 6,000 BTU/hr, and a refrigeration system capacity of 3.5 tons.

Question_Title: During the operation of a large multi-box refrigeration system, using a fixed capacity compressor, only two of the  five boxes are in the process of actively being cooled.  If two additional boxes were to be brought into the cooling process simultaneously, the __________.

Question_Title: Which of the following devices is the safest to use when locating ammonia leaks?
Answer_4: All of the above are recommended.

Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: The receiver used in a refrigeration system __________.
Answer_4: prevents liquid refrigerant from slugging to the compressor

Question_Title: Average condensing pressures of an ammonia refrigeration system range between __________.

Answer_2: fitted with return valves at the bilge manifolds
Answer_3: coated with coal tar epoxy, or similar corrosion resistant  substance
Answer_4: fitted with nonreturn valves at the bilge suctions

Question_Title: An ammonia leak will turn moistened pink litmus paper __________.

Answer_2: liquid refrigerant pressure at the solenoid valve
Answer_3: pressure drop across the evaporator coils
Answer_4: temperature of the evaporator coil outlet

Question_Title: Under normal conditions ammonia refrigerants should be added at the  __________.

Answer_1: use your service gage set and refrigeration card
Answer_2: look at the unit name plate
Answer_4: look on the top of the TXV

Question_Title: Pure anhydrous ammonia is considered noncorrosive to __________.
Answer_4: None of the above are correct.

Question_Title: If auxiliary machinery vital to the main propulsion system  is not provided with independent duplicate systems, which of the systems listed would satisfy regulations if serviced by two pumps? (46 CFR)
When used as a refrigerant, ammonia containing moisture will act as a corrosive mixture to __________.
Answer_4: All of the above are correct.

Question_Title: When hot gas defrosting a refrigeration system, one way to  overcome the possibility of a large slug of liquid  refrigerant entering the compressor suction is to use the installed __________.
If the combination moisture indicator and sight glass indicates an accumulation of moisture within the system, which of the listed procedures would be the most practical  to follow?
Answer_1: Secure the system, disassemble and de-ice the thermostatic  expansion valve.
Answer_2: Close the king valve, pump down the system, isolate the drier, remove and replace with new drier element.
Answer_3: Purge the entire system to the atmosphere, replace the drier, and add freon.
Answer_4: Using a vacuum pump, draw the system down to 1,270 microns  for a period of three hours.

Question_Title: Which of the listed valves should be closed when adding ammonia to a refrigeration system?
Which refrigeration system will require the use of an oil trap?
The distillate pump for a 10000 GPD evaporator, should be rated at a minimum of __________.
For most refrigeration split systems that use one sight glass, a good location for the sight glass is just __________.
Answer_4: upstream of the liquid metering device

Question_Title: A flapper valve, also known as a beam valve, is frequently  used in refrigeration compressor discharge valves, and is designed to __________.
Answer_1: feed discharge pressure to the suction line
Answer_4: equalize system pressure for compressor cycling

Question_Title: Refrigerant recovery equipment that is considered as being  system dependent __________.
Answer_1: must have its own power source
Answer_2: recovers refrigerant with the aid of components in the system

Question_Title: A P-tank system, as used on oilfield supply boats __________.
Answer_1: must be kept free of moisture and water
Answer_2: is designed to transfer viscous liquids
Answer_3: is capable of pumping chunks of cement that find their way  into the system

Question_Title: The suction pressure switch controlling the refrigeration compressor operation is actuated by __________.
Answer_3: temperature acting on a thermal element
Answer_4: pressure acting on compressor suction valves

Question_Title: Refrigerant entering the compressor of a refrigeration system should be in which of the following conditions?
Inhalation of high concentrations of CFCs may have which of the following effects?
The chemical formula for ozone is represented as __________.
R-12 has been a suitable refrigerant for use in high temperature applications with __________.
When taking readings at the suction service valve of an operating refrigeration compressor __________.
Answer_1: the pressure, or temperature reading is only required, as the refrigerant is saturated
Answer_2: the pressure and temperature reading is required as the refrigerant is probably subcooled
Answer_3: the pressure and temperature reading is required as the refrigerant is superheated
Answer_4: the readings at this location must always be recorded as  pressure absolute and degrees centigrade

Question_Title: Refrigerant leaving the metering device in a refrigeraton system is a __________.
Operating pressure on a P-tank system should be __________.
Answer_1: the same pressure required for repressurization and cleaning the system
Answer_2: a constantly maintained range of 15 to 18 psi
Answer_3: slightly below the pilot unloading valve setting
Answer_4: slightly below the safety valve setting

Question_Title: If you know that a refrigeration system is leaking  refrigerant, you would first___________.
Which of the devices listed will indicate the proper operation of a refrigeration system dryer?
Which of the following base oils cannot be refined without  developing a change in chemical composition?
Which recovery phase will reduce the loss of oil during the recovery of refrigerants from small appliances such as a water cooler?
Large quantities of halogenated floro-carbons when released from refrigeration systems, will contribute to ozone depletion in the __________.
Which can be considered as a drop-in replacement refrigerant?
In a multi-evaporator refrigeration system, a solenoid valve is installed in the liquid line before __________.
Which of the following statements regarding refrigeration systems is/are true?
Answer_1: In any refrigeration system, oil and refrigerant are always present.
Answer_2: Refrigerant is the working fluid and is required for cooling.
Answer_3: The main purpose of the oil is to lubricate the compressor.

Question_Title: Industrial process and commercial refrigeration equipment with annual leak rates of 35% or more, require leak repair of the system containing refrigerant of more than __________.

Answer_3: chunks of material are moving through the system and transfer will stop momentarily
Answer_4: inadequate fluidizing of the weight material

Question_Title: A boiler forced draft pressure gage indicates nine (9) inches of water.  This corresponds to a pressure of __________.

Most refrigerants are originated primarily from which of the following base molecules?
Which of the listed chemicals will eventually reach the stratosphere and react unfavorably with ozone?

Answer_3: amount of refrigerant in the system
Answer_4: temperature of the refrigerant after expansion

Question_Title: In a refrigeration system with a TXV, the component installed after the metering device is the __________.

Answer_1: gray top and yellow lower body
Answer_2: gray top and light blue lower body
Answer_3: light blue top and yellow lower body

Question_Title: The purpose of nozzles in a liquid mud system is to_________.
Answer_1: aerate the mud to insure proper oxygen content
Answer_2: maintain the quality of the mud
Answer_3: clean the mud from the bottom of the tanks
Answer_4: Prevent barate from damaging the pump

Question_Title: A pneumercator is an instrument used to indicate __________.
Answer_1: air pressure in the diesel engine starting circuit

Question_Title: Movement of the material discharge hoses, fluctuating P-tank air pressure and a light dust trail from the receiving tank vent indicates __________.
Answer_2: improper movement of the weight material
Answer_3: chunks of material are in the system and will stop the flow momentarily

Question_Title: Why do OSV's with a liquid mud system generally have more than two tanks?
Answer_1: To increase the quantity of mud carried.
Answer_2: The pumps are unable to handle the greater quantity of mud  carried by one or two tanks.
Answer_3: To reduce the amount of free communication therefore, reducing the center of gravity of the OSV.
Answer_4: To prevent list and stability problems when receiving half a load of fluid from the rig.

Question_Title: Pressure in the control tubing of a thermostatic expansion valve depends upon a dirct relationship with the __________.
Answer_2: amount of superheat at the outlet of the evaporator
Answer_4: heat transferred from the saturated liquid in the evaporator

Question_Title: In a liquid mud system, the sea valve must be tightly secured and not leak because___________.
Answer_1: a leaking sea valve decreases stability of the OSV
Answer_2: any leakage can destroy the product being transported
Answer_3: leaking oil-base mud creates an enviromental hazard according to Coast Guard regulations (33 CFR)
Answer_4: more liquid mud will be discharged to the MODU than ordered

Question_Title: Which of the following steps should be taken before taking  on a load of liquid mud for transport to a MODU?
Answer_1: Inspect tanks to insure they are clean and dry.
Answer_2: Test a sample to insure that the emulsifying amines do not  exceed a STEL of 25 ppm.
Answer_3: Flood the tanks with carbon dioxide and test product with an explosimeter (gas detector).

Question_Title: It is important to circulate the liquid mud on an OSV at regular intervals to___________.
Answer_1: keep the mud ingredients in suspension and retain weight properties
Answer_2: reduce the free surface effect and increase the metacentric height (GM) during transport
Answer_3: increase the free surface effect and reduce the metacentric height (GM) during transport
Answer_4: minimize the release of explosive gases during transport

Question_Title: It is important to circulate liquid mud on an OSV to_______.
Answer_1: insure that the liquid mud maintains a weight of less than  8.3 lbs/gal.
Answer_2: reduce damage to the mud due to salt water contamination
Answer_3: ensure that the pump suctions remain unplugged and keep the liquid mud in good condition
Answer_4: reduce corrosion damage due to the acidic nature of zinc bromide

Question_Title: Unless told otherwise by the mud dock representative, the recomended circulation time and rate for most new water based liquid mud for each tank is___________.
Answer_1: once a day for three hours with a diesel powered mud pump at half throttle
Answer_2: thirty to sixty minutes every twelve hours with a diesel powered pump at full throttle or by a high capacity electric mud pump
Answer_3: one day circulating, three days off with a small electric mud pump
Answer_4: fifteen minutes every six hours with a small pump, or diesel pump at half throttle

Question_Title: HCFC-22 has been recovered from a refrigeration system during replacement of the condenser.  The refrigerant can be __________.
Answer_1: recycled into a system that had used HCFC-11
Answer_2: reclaimed as a low pressure system refrigerant
Answer_4: must be destroyed, as it can no longer be used

Answer_1: sent to a designated reclaimation facility for processing

Answer_2: discharge the material at an excessive rate

Answer_4: do not need to recover the refrigerant

Question_Title: Which of the following types of refrigerants could  experience fractionation?

Answer_4: there is no difference between the devices

Answer_2: discharge pressure of the recovery compressor

Question_Title: How do the modulating valves, found in some container refrigeration systems, differ in operation from solenoid valves found in the same system?
Answer_1: An unenergized modulation valve is in the normally open position.
Answer_2: An unenergized modulation valve is in the completely closed position.
Answer_3: An unenergized solenoid valve is in the normally open position.
Answer_4: All modulation valves have the identical operating  characteristics as solenoid valves used in refrigeration systems.

Question_Title: All refrigeration systems must be protected with a __________.

Answer_4: venting to atmosphere, cannot be recovered

Answer_2: the United States Department of Transportation

Question_Title: If you find an extremely large refrigerant leak while using a halide torch, your flame will __________.

Answer_1: A solenoid valve can only be installed in liquid lines.

Answer_3: Solenoid valves are only used in low voltage refrigeration  control systems, while modulation valves are used in high voltage applications.
Answer_4: Both valves operate in exactly the same manner, only the manufacturer's terminology is the differentiating factor.

Question_Title: Which of the following instruments can be used to measure the rate of air flow?

Answer_2: temperature of the box is increasing

Question_Title: When using nitrogen to pressure leak test a system, the nitrogen tank should always have a __________.

Answer_2: suction pressure of the compressor will rise

Question_Title: The intentional venting of class I and II refrigerants to the atmosphere within the territorial limits of the United  States became unlawful on __________.

Answer_1: move to the open position due to the flow of refrigerant across the valve orifice

Answer_3: if they will be performing maintenance, service or repair that could resonably be expected to release Class 1 or Class 2 refrigerants into the atmosphere

Question_Title: A particular space is air conditioned by a 25 ton water cooled system.  While troubleshooting, the space is found to be too warm, and the compressor is not operating.  A service check determines the compressor suction pressure to be above the normal cut-in point, with a normal head pressure, and high evaporator superheat.  Which of the problems listed is the cause for the conditions stated above?
Answer_1: A liquid line service valve is partially closed.
Answer_2: The expansion valve feeler bulb is loosely clamped to the suction line.
Answer_3: The suction pressure control contacts are stuck open.
Answer_4: A suction line is kinked or partially obstructed and blocking refrigerant circulation.

Question_Title: Solenoid valves used in refrigeration systems may be classified as __________.

Answer_4: initially liquid charged and then topped with a vapor charge

Question_Title: The air compressor for a P-tank unit should be operated for several minutes with its discharge valves open to the atmosphere to __________.
Answer_1: discharge moisture formed during the compression process
Answer_2: dry out fixed discharge piping and hoses
Answer_3: assist in producing water free compressed air

Question_Title: In a chilled water air conditioning unit using a reciprocating compressor, the refrigerating effect of the primary refrigerant can be increased by __________.
Answer_1: increasing refrigerant pressure in the coil
Answer_2: increasing chilled water flow through the cooler
Answer_3: subcooling the refrigerant in the condenser
Answer_4: superheating the refrigerant in the compressor

Question_Title: In a refrigeration system, which of the following statements describes the actions occurring when a solenoid valve, used in conjunction with an unloader head, is energized?
Answer_1: The solenoid valve directs high pressure gas to the valve lifting device raising the suction valve off its seat and causing one specific cylinder to become unloaded.
Answer_2: The solenoid valve directs high pressure gas to the underside of the unloading piston, causing it to rise and allowing the recirculating ports to be opened.
Answer_3: When the solenoid valve becomes energized, the valve ports  become closed, allowing discharge pressure to build up above the piston, shifting it and causing it to unload.
Answer_4: The solenoid valve allows the refrigerant to pass from the  suction chamber to the top of the unloader piston, causing  the piston to lift and unload the cylinder.

Question_Title: Moisture is removed from CFC-12 using a recycler by __________.
Answer_2: opening a drain petcock on the oil separator
Answer_3: condensing the water in the condenser

Question_Title: Of the four refrigerants CFC-11, CFC-12, HFC-134a, and HCFC-22; HCFC-22 operates at the __________.
Answer_1: lowest system pressure with the lowest boiling point
Answer_2: highest system pressure with the lowest boiling point
Answer_3: lowest system pressure with the highest boiling point
Answer_4: highest system pressure with the highest boiling point

Answer_1: superheat of the gas leaving the compressor
Answer_4: degree of superheat of the gas leaving the evaporator

Answer_3: the teflon film from being damaged by the corrosive effects of excessive handling

Answer_3: the air is circulated slowly with a minimum temperature change
Answer_4: a humidifier is installed within the refrigeration system

When removing the primary refrigerant from a system using water as a secondary refrigerant, it is important to follow which procedure(s) to safeguard the equipment?
Answer_1: Insure that the water doesn't become contaminated with oil  in the direct contact heat exchanger.
Answer_2: Insure that the water and refrigerant separator is  functioning properly.
Answer_3: Insure that the water is drained or continually circulating to avoid freeze-up.
Answer_4: Leave some refrigerant in the system to prevent the water from contaminating the referigerant if there is a leak.
